title: RE: Nord Drum 2 sysex implementation
post_content: Hi @saxwell! Not sure if still relevant for you but stumbled across this post and thought I'd chime in nonetheless.Were you looking to send the bank files containing multiple programs? Or just individual programs? Looking at the bank files they are in a proprietary format not suitable for sysex transfers but you could certainly dump the programs from the ND2 to a pc/mac/ios and then send back using a sysex tool like Midi-OX (Windows), Sysex Librarian (Mac), or Sysex Base (iOS). This way the individual program files are standard sysex files of a fixed length (110 bytes for the ND1, not sure about the ND2).Transfer setup appears to be manual only (no remote midi dump request).Cheers!Ken

title: RE: Nord Drum 3P sync with Nord Wave 2
post_content: Which device is providing master clock function?  From the manual:EXTERNAL SYNCThe Master Clock on the Wave 2 can be controlled by incoming MIDIclock messages. This is an automatic behavior: As soon as the Wave 2receives MIDI clock on the MIDI input or the USB MIDI input, the MasterClock will be synchronized to the incoming external clock.When the Master Clock is locked to an incoming clock, “MIDI” will beshown in the display if MST CLK is pressed, together with the incomingtempo in BPM.-dj

title: RE: Nord Drum 3P sync with Nord Wave 2

title: RE: Send one midi channel per pad
post_content: Hi hummelman,That is correct, the individual MIDI channels are mainly* there to control sound parameters of the 3p, it's one direction only. The 3p sends MIDI notes on the 'global' MIDI channel, a note is coupled with a drum channel (drum sound) you can set which note is coupled to which drum channel, your drum pattern in the sequencer should therefore comprise of these 6 notes only. If the 3p receives these notes on the same (global) MIDI channel the corresponding drum channels will be triggered. *When you're sending MIDI notes on the individual MIDI channels, the note will determine the pitch of the corresponding drum sound, and the MIDI channel determines which drum channel is addressed.Hope this helps,Albert

If the 3p receives these notes on the same (global) MIDI channel the corresponding channels will be triggered. *When you're sending MIDI notes on the individual MIDI channels, the note will determine the pitch of the corresponding drum sound, and the MIDI channel determines which drum channel is addressed.Hope this helps,AlbertThanks a lot for a quick and thorough reply. title: RE: Send one midi channel per pad
post_content: hummelman wrote:Thanks a lot for a quick and thorough reply. So if the question is "can I send midi on six different channels from the 3p, one from each pad" then the answer is "no"?Yep, the answer is no..hummelman wrote:And then, should I invest in an old ipad and use the nord beat app as sequencer for the 3p instead? What I am after is the ability to record what I am playing on the 3p pads to a sequencer and have the sequencer play this back, as part of my live set. WITH the ability to mute for instance the recording of the kick (for example in a break) and then unmute it again. Hope u get what I am afterWell, you'll need a sequencer or app that is capable of recording a polyphonic MIDI track, the MIDI tracks on Digitakt are polyphonic, but only 4 notes, 2 less than you need. Nord Beat does not record MIDI, you can only enter a pattern of notes on the iPad screen, but there are other apps that will record and loop, I would first explore which apps would suit your needs, watch a lot of Youtube demo's and tutorials, an iPad is great but I wouldn't buy it just for that purpose. Also check compatibility of older iPads with current iPadOS, I'm on an iPad Air 2 from 2014, still fast enough for a lot of stuff, but they will possibly drop support and no longer provide this model with OS updates next year, which means less and less (new) apps will be compatible in the years that follow.Cheers,Albert

title: Send one midi channel per pad
post_content: Hi, so I had the same problem as everyone else here: I wanted torecord pads 1-6 of my Nord Drum 3P via MIDI channel 10-16 into 6 tracks of my sequencer(in my case a lovely Polyend Seq), but the Nord Drum 3P only sends MIDI Out Notes on a single channel, so I recorded all 6 pads into a single track which was quite a mess.So what I wanted was- change "MIDI channel 16, Note On, Note value #60" to "MIDI channel 10, Note On, Note value 60"- change "MIDI channel 16, Note On, Note value #62" to "MIDI channel 11, Note On, Note value 62"- change "MIDI channel 16, Note On, Note value #64" to "MIDI channel 12, Note On, Note value 64"- change "MIDI channel 16, Note On, Note value #65" to "MIDI channel 13, Note On, Note value 65"- change "MIDI channel 16, Note On, Note value #67" to "MIDI channel 14, Note On, Note value 66"- change "MIDI channel 16, Note On, Note value #69" to "MIDI channel 15, Note On, Note value 67"and then the same for Note Off, as this is what the Nord Drum 3P does - found that out with the Mac app "MIDI Monitor":https://www.snoize.com/midimonitor/[note that the PITCH of the note is transmitted in another MIDI value, so you can still change the pitch in the Nord Drum 3P and send it and play it back]Here's how I achieved that:1. bought an Event Processor Plushttp://www.midisolutions.com/prodepp.htmfrom MIDI Solutions and a $20 USB-to-MIDI cable from Amazon(the Note On / Note off commands above are already 12 commands, the Event Processor non-plus can handle only 10 while the Plus handles up to 32)2. connected my Macbook with the cable and plugged it into MIDI In of the Event Processor Plus … but the cable couldn't power the device, so I also3. connected MIDI Out from the Nord Drum 3P to MIDI Out of the Event Processor Plus to power it4. selected the above "Map a MIDI Event" settings in MIDI Solution's free apphttp://www.midisolutions.com/progtool.htmand sent them to the device … remember to change the setting numbers, here's my code:Event Processor Plus Settings_mik_080621.rtfProgram Code for Event Processor Plus(4.16 KiB) Downloaded 227 times5. if you do everything right, the device will flicker for 1 second after EACH transmitted command. If you do it wrong, it will at the most go dark for a fraction of a second6. I could then unplug the device and use it directly with the Nord DrumSo now I'm recording my 6 pads through 6 channels into 6 sequencer tracks, mission accomplishedProgrammingNoteworthy is what didn´t work to do the programming - apparently some instruments / keyboards / sequencers change or withold bits of the transmitted MIDI programming:Mac --- usb ---> Arturia Keystep 32 --- midi ---> Event Processor PlusMac --- usb ---> Polyend Seq --- midi ---> Kenton Thru 12 --- midi ---> Event Processor PlusMac --- usb ---> Argon8M --- midi ---> Event Processor Plus <--- midi power --- Nord Drum 3PMac --- usb midi cable ---> Event Processor Plus <--- midi power --- Nord Drum 3PEveryday useNord Drum 3P --- midi ---> Event Processor Plus --- midi ---> sequencerNord Drum 3P --- midi ---> Event Processor Plus --- midi ---> Arturia Keystep 32 in Thru Mode --- midi ---> sequencerHope this helpsStill don't understand why I need to buy a 169 € MIDI translator while the myriads of MIDI Out problem posts in this forum could ALL be solved with a simple firmware update!Note (edited): One bummer is though that the MIDI Solutions Software Tool isonly working up to Mac OS 10.14 Mojave, not Catalina or newer. It does work with even OS 10.6 that I have on a very old Mac mini that I use as a server and for network backups.

title: RE: Send one midi channel per pad
post_content: Hi G3cdG3cd,Great to hear that you managed to route the MIDI notes to different MIDI channels!Personally I prefer to have a drum pattern in a single track in my DAW, but that's just personal and there might be other (hardware) sequencers that may not work with that concept, and require output per MIDI channel.One remark though, if you send the same MIDI notes 60-67 back to the 3p's individual MIDI channels, the pitch will not be the same as you programmed them, if you want the same pitch when you send the notes back via the Individual MIDI channels, you want to transform all notes to note #60.Curious to know; did you try if the solution mentioned above by MMS-NORD also works on the 3p?I bet you did, otherwise you wouldn't have needed the MIDI box, but you didn't mention it..I think most confusion in other threads is about how to control the Nord Drums via MIDI (Individual vs Global), but yeah it would be nice if they'd make sending MIDI from the 3p to other gear on the Individual MIDI channels an option..Cheers,Albert

title: RE: Send one midi channel per pad

When I recorded into a single global channel before, the sound DID shift though depending what pad I hit (and then played everything back with the sound allocated to pad 1), so I can understand what you mean.Changing the pitch to the lower 15 notes was not applicable for me as especially the high hats and stuff are often in a range of a pitch of 80-110.Another things I was worried about was a MIDI loop, btw, so I expected that changing the channel 16 note to channel 10, then leading it into my sequencer that goes back into the Nord MIGHT create an infinite loop or at least a slight echo. But even with Lo On, PC Sr and CC Sr, there is no loop or echo, bless the Clavia Gods!

title: RE: Send one midi channel per pad
post_content: Hi G3cdG3cd,When using the Global MIDI channel to trigger drum sounds, the MIDI note is only used to address the correct drum channel, the Tone pitch parameter determines the pitch. When using the individual MIDI channels, both the MIDI note that you send to the 3p, and the Tone pitch parameter determine the pitch of the drum sound. You can use this feature to play melodies on a single drum channel. Only if you send MIDI note 60, you will hear the original programmed pitch of the Tone pitch parameter. If you set the Tone pitch parameter to 60, the pitch will correspond to the MIDI note that the 3p receives (a C triggers a C, etc).However, -and I think this explains your observations- if your 3p receives back the notes via the loop* that includes your MIDI transformation then I'd expect it to behave as you descibe it: you'll hear the same pitch while playing live or recording as when playing back the recording. But if you then disconnect all MIDI, I'd expect the pitch of some of the drum channels to be lower.*Normally I'd say this requires to have Local Off on the 3p, but the incoming note apparently overrides (cuts off) the original note that was triggered internally quickly enough to not hear it.Btw, I actually never tested the method of MMS-Nord, so I decided to do so now, I was surprised to find out that it doesn't seem to work on my ND2 (OS3.0) either, notes are still only sent on the Global MIDI channel, whatever other MIDI settings and configurations I try..Albert

title: RE: ND3P Instrument Definitions
post_content: Thanks Albert,(Sorry I just saw this) The .xml instrument definition file gives your DAW (Cubase Pro 11 in my case) the list of instruments that it can choose through MIDI so when you insert a MIDI track into your multitrack session you have your whole keyboard instrument list there in the DAW and you can choose the instrument you want to use from the list without having to go to your keyboard. post_content: Hi Barry,Perhaps this is the 'Pad follow' function (page 6 of the manual)?Cheers,Albert

post_content: Alas no. The individual pads are continually changed whether Pad Follow is on or off. The MIDI notes it receives changes the pad regardless, but only when the MPC sequence is playing. When playback is stopped, if I trigger the Nord using the MPC pads, it doesn’t follow. Weird.

title: RE: Stop Channels Changing During MIDI Playback
post_content: Strange,Do you have MIDI monitoring software to check what the difference is between MIDI notes sent from the sequencer of the MPC, and notes sent from the pads of the MPC?Are you using individual MIDI channels or the Global MIDI channel to trigger the 3p?Cheers,Albert

title: RE: Stop Channels Changing During MIDI Playback
post_content: I tried it with a Digitakt tonight and that works smoothly. As with the MPC2500, triggering midi notes does not change the Pad Follow, this can only be done when the device is in Local On and triggered from a drum pad. The Digitakt doesn’t not exhibit the same problem as stated in the original post.I made a sequence on the Digitakt, to play the 3p and it has exceptionally solid timing. The use of CC’s also make it extremely good fun with Spectra / Decay and Reverb send. As there is no MIDI Thru on the 3p, and the Digitakt doesn’t send MIDI Clock on its Thru output (3p is using MIDI out), the only choice was to make the MPC the master, Digitakt the slave to play the 3p by playing to the MPC midi clock. All three are so rock solid together. I love the MPC simply because it’s so reliable. No crappy software midi drop outs or timing issues.

title: RE: Stop Channels Changing During MIDI Playback
post_content: Hi Barry,Nice video.. The only way to find out what is sent to the 3p is to route the MIDI back to the interface and monitor or record it, with MIDI monitoring software you should be able to see individual messages with a time stamp, like note on, note off, CCs etc. If you compare that with the messages sent by the MPC whilst playing the pads (which doesn't cause the note following behavior) you should be able to find out if there is a difference.As for your goal of controlling individual drum sounds: why not try to use the Individual MIDI channels of the 3p? Problem perhaps then is that you'd have to find a way to select which channel you want to edit, maybe you can set something up in Ableton to select the MIDI channel with the pads on your controller?I don't understand why this following behavior depends on the CC settings, strange.Cheers,Albert

title: RE: how can i quickly verify that my 3p pads are working?
post_content: Hi Nelson,I'm surprised it doesn't work out of the box, with local on it should work, did you try lowering the trigger threshold?I'd say that hitting the pads with a stick or a spoon is most effective, by raising the sensitivity and lowering the threshold you should get some response from the unit..Albert

title: RE: how can i quickly verify that my 3p pads are working?

title: Available Voltage on MIDI Out
post_content: I would like to connect to the MIDI Out of a Nord Drum 3P a MIDI Solutions Event Processor to overcome the MIDI restrictions - the Event Processor is a translator that can turn "Channel 16, Note 60" into "Channel 10, Note 60" for example and as such I would be able to route 6 pads to 6 different MIDI channels instead of only one Global (which seems to be a HUGE dumb problem, every 2nd question in this forum is MIDI related, why can't Clavia Nord fix this???)BUT: the Event Processor requires 5V power through MIDI out, it doesn´t have a power supply of its own and apparently, some "modern" synths only provide 3.3V. Does anyone know how much voltage the Nord Drum provides on MIDI Out?

title: RE: Available Voltage on MIDI Out
post_content: If you haven't purchased the Event Processor yet, newer Midi Solutions Event processors work at 3.3vIf you already own the Event Processor, just plug it in and see if it works.

title: RE: Available Voltage on MIDI Out
post_content: Hi,Actually, fellow forum user MMS_NORD found out that if you use the lowest notes, in the range 0-15 the ND2 will send on corresponding MIDI channels 1-16, perhaps the 3P does the same, see:nord-drum-forum-f27/send-one-midi-chann ... ml#p138207As for the MIDI solutions box, I remember that they listed Nord keyboards as incompatible with their products, I wouldn't be surprised if the same holds true for the Nord drum series.Perhaps try Blokas MIDI hub, if you still need this functionality given the possible solution found by MMS_NORD..Albert

title: RE: Available Voltage on MIDI Out
post_content: So I got the MIDI Solutions device, plugged it in and yes, the Nord Drum 3P does provide enough power for it, even though the Event aprocessor Plus is still one of the old 5V devices.So the answer is: The Nord Drum 3P provides 5V through MIDI out.

title: RE: Clicking noise through bass drum trigger
post_content: Hi Matze,I don't own the 3p so I can't check, but perhaps you could try if the click can also be heard if you're triggering channel 1 with the trig button set at maximum velocity. If so, it's just part of the sound, perhaps you can reach higher velocities more easily with your pedal (or that input) than by striking the pad. I think it's a good idea to evaluate the difference in a recording, rather than directly while playing, in case the pedal itself is noisy. I'd be surprised if the electrical signal from the pedal is bleeding through to the audio output, not sure if that is possible at all, but if you suspect that, I'd have the 3p checked.Good luck!Albert

post_content: Hi there,I just bought a brand new Nord 3p and I am loving it. Connected it up to an Akai MPC2500, Digitakt and Ableton Live (to ensure its not a Midi fault) to try and solve why the unit will not receive CC data for the following and I am stumped -Reverb Type CC12Reverb Color CC13Delay Time CC44Delay Feedback CC45Literally everything else works - Volume, Pan and every other ones I have tried from the published CC list in the manual, but not these four.The 3P is responding on individual MIDI channels - 1-6 so I can control sounds independently.I am on firmware 1.24Thanks in advance...

title: RE: Nord 3P - CC data Reverb / Delay parameters
post_content: Hi, welcome to NUF, have you tried to see if those CCs are also sent by the 3P (when you modify the associated parameter) and on which channel?

title: RE: Nord 3P - CC data Reverb / Delay parameters
post_content: The Nord 3P will not allow modification of those CC parameters when the unit is used in 6 channel MIDI mode. If I turn off GLOBAL back on, the CC's can be modified. That's disappointing. It doesn't say that in the manual.

title: RE: Nord 3P - CC data Reverb / Delay parameters
post_content: Hi 8bit Barry,Perhaps it has to do with the fact that the delay and reverb effects are applied to the whole kit, so controlling them per individual MIDI channel wouldn't really make sense anyway,8bit Barry wrote:If I turn off GLOBAL back on, the CC's can be modified.Did you turn the Global MIDI channel off or on? Perhaps the way to control these global effects is through the global MIDI channel. You can use Global and Individual MIDI channels at the same time as long as you choose a different MIDI channel for it than for the six Individual channels, (say 10 while indiv. channels are eg. 1-6).Cheers,Albert

title: RE: Nord 3P - CC data Reverb / Delay parameters
post_content: I didn’t know that - I was under the assumption you chose one or the other. Seems like a weird setup - I can’t think of any other device that does this. I’ll try it out and report back.So you think the drums will respond on 1-6 (for example) and the unit can operate the CC parameters on a separate midi channel?

title: RE: Nord 3P - CC data Reverb / Delay parameters
post_content: Hi Barry,Yes, you can control sound parameters of the individual drum sounds using MIDI channels (eg) 1-6, and at the same time trigger the drum sounds, and (I suppose) also the delay and reverb parameters (with before mentioned CCs) using the global MIDI channel (eg 10).You can also trigger the drum sounds using the individual MIDI channels, but then the MIDI note that you send will determine the pitch of the Tone section of the drum sound, if you send note number 60, it will have the same pitch as you programmed it. By triggering the drum sounds via the global MIDI channel, the drum sounds will always have the pitch as you programmed them.When you send MIDI CCs on the global MIDI channel to control drum sound parameters, only the drum sound that is currently selected will be affected, but as reverb and delay are global effects, I think you should be able to control them using the Global MIDI channel, and regardless of which drum channel is selected.Cheers,Albert

title: RE: Use of 2 Nord Drum on an external Drum Sound Module
post_content: Hi Derbin,I think you need to merge the MIDI data from your two 3p units, there are Kenton MIDI mergers that can do that, but also check the Blokas MIDI hub, because it can merge, plus a lot more, it's quite easy to 'program' on a computer (it doesn't need to remain connected to your computer after it is programmed to merge the 2 MIDI signals). On the 3p units program the notes in the MIDI menu, so that together they will output 12 unique notes.. Connect the output of the MIDI merger to the MIDI in port of the sampler (or whatever unit), program the sampler to listen to the 12 MIDI notes..Cheers,Albert

You could cut/strip a short length of  ordinary Ethernet cable leaving the plug on one end, then plug that into the pad and do some measuring on the other end with a decent multimeter to see what's coming out -  if you are lucky you might find a common/ground pin and different voltages being sent depending on velocity etc. if it's some kind of digital data coming out then I don't fancy your chances.However, I am very much of the poke-it-and-see-what-happens school, so it's probably best you just ignore me or you might break something/burn down your house/kill yourself.if you could get hold of a technical/service manual you would save yourself a lot of trouble, but I haven't found any

title: RE: Nord Pad connector pin out
post_content: Ok, so this is what I've found out. Using a probe to take a +ve DC voltage out from my modular and looking into the RJ45 socket on the ND2, the 6 pins running from right to left trigger ascending channels on the ND. Note that this is just using the +ve voltage - I'm not providing any ground reference or connection to any other pins on the RJ45, although I did have some of the trigger jack sockets connected between the modular and the ND so its possible there was a common ground there.The remaining 2 pins are a mystery. I don't know if they are supposed to be ground or if that just floats and they are redundant. But I can't see anything coming out from them and they don't appear to have any input function.So 6 steps closer to an answer.

title: RE: Nord Pad connector pin out
post_content: OK, just to update where I'm at. I have an Intellijel Linix module which is basically 6 VCAs in one module. It has an expander header on the rear to connect it to other modules in that series so the 6 individual outputs on the module face are duplicated on this header. Only the +ve signal is present at the header.I've adapted a standard cat 5 cable to bring the signal on those 6 pins out to the first 6 pins on an RJ45 to connect it to the ND2.And it works.Like this.I can't use the 6th channel on the Linix because of how its normalised (it sums the other 5 channels) but its a proof of concept if nothing else. Should be fairly simple to make a small breakout module.

title: RE: Nord Pad connector pin out
post_content: Hi, because this thread was very helpful I registered just to post the following, for future readers:I have a Nord Pad but no Drum, so I wanted to adapt the Pad to trigger any drum module.I can confirm the final two pins of the RJ45 are voltage and neutral. #8 is neutral, pin #7 is positive voltage.The purpose of the voltage input (as in, electricity supplied BY the Nord Drum TO the Nord Pad) #7 is to amplify the signals from the drum pads. Inside the Pad there are two amplifier chips (Z974 see data sheethttps://www.ti.com/lit/ds/slos467h/slos467h.pdf). You don't necessarily need this voltage, as without a power supply the output from the pads will still come out from wires #1-6, as long as you wire up all the triggers to the shared neutral #8. If your drum module is able to respond to the low voltage output without amplification you'll be fine without the amplifier chips and won't need to wire up #7.If you do need amplification, you probably won't need much voltage. The Z974 chips are rated 2.7V - 15V for their input voltage but I found I was able to get a good signal boost just from a minimal voltage. I found the chips heat up with a higher voltage so it'd be best to use the minimum voltage you need to trigger your module adequately. When I wire everything up properly I will try installing two AAA batteries (3V) but you could also power by USB (5V).I don't have access to a Nord Drum 2 so I don't know what voltage it outputs as standard.The Nord Drum 2 is hard to find, even second-hand, but I was able to buy a Nord Pad brand new on clearance. So if you're willing to do a basic bit of electronics to wire it up, the Nord Pad is still an attractive and probably cheap option.

title: RE: Nord drum 3P Compatibility with sound modules and VSTs
post_content: Hi Derbin,Perhaps, yes, but it probably depends a bit on the instruments or VSTs you want to control, the Nord 3p sends a different MIDI note for each of the 6 pads on 1 MIDI channel, a bit like a keyboard with only 6 keys.Hope this helps..Cheers,Albert

title: RE: Nord drum 3P to Nord drum (1)
post_content: Hi Lollo, welcome to the forum!No, that is not possible, there are similarities but the 3p and 2 have some unique sound parameters, the programs are not compatible, cannot be transferred or transformed.Cheers,Albert

title: RE: Nord drum 3P to Nord drum (1)
post_content: Hi Lollo,If you want more voices of exactly the same sounds then yes, otherwise you can program other or similar sounds on the 2 and combine them in one setup, the 2 doesn't have reverb though..Albert

title: Nord Drum 3p Midi Connections
post_content: Hey guys ,Please help me Out!Well I'm a beginner in the field of music and do not have much knowledge about music production but I'm really hoping you guys can help me with this following problem:I have a Nord Drum Pad 3p and a Roland Um One Mk2 Usb Midi interface. It will be really appreciated and really make my day .Cheers-TheJackSparrow

title: RE: Nord Drum 3p Midi Connections
post_content: Hi Jack, welcome to the forum!If you want to record the audio from your 3p, you'll need an audio interface, not a MIDI interface. MIDI is only for note information, so only which note (padj you play can be recorded with the MIDI interface.I can't help you with Garageband, I find it quite a confusing app on the iPad, but that's probably just me..Cheers,Albert

title: RE: Nord Drum 3p Midi Connections
post_content: Thanks Albert !-TheJackSparrow

title: RE: Nord Drum 3p - factory settings ?
post_content: Hi Karl, welcome to the forum,The factory banks can be downloaded here :https://www.nordkeyboards.com/sound-lib ... ory-soundsOther settings can only be reset manually if I'm correct, default values can befound in the manual.Cheers,Albert

title: RE: Nord Drum 3p - factory settings ?
post_content: Hello,Thanx you very much for your help.In fact, i can’t manage to work with the norddrum 3p and his iOS app (nordbeat3) any more.The pad 1 and 6 always play when i play the other pad.Here are my parameters midi on te norddrum 3p :Lo : OfGl : 1Ch : 1Nt : 61Pc : ofCc : srI have try with other parameters but it do not work.Could you help me please ?Kg

title: RE: Nord Drum 3p - factory settings ?
post_content: Hi Karl,The problem is that you switched on the individual MIDI channel(s), make sure you switch that off, that's the setting where you see Ch in the display, setting should be OF (off) on all 6 drum channels.Cheers,Albert

title: RE: Nord Drum 3p - factory settings ?
post_content: Hellothank you again for your help. It's nice to take time to answer me.But, it doesn't work even if i choose Ch = Offmaybe my midi interface has a problem.KG

title: RE: Nord Drum 3p - factory settings ?
post_content: Hi Karl,Also make sure that the MIDI note is different for each of the 6 drum channels. if for example drum channel 1 and 6 share the same MIDI note, they will always be triggered at the same time, check the note numbers in the app, they should correspond with the ones in the 3p. I think the default is:channel 1: 60channel 2: 62channel 3: 64channel 4: 65channel 5: 67channel 6: 69Some very cheap MIDI interfaces do some weird stuff, can even mess up simple tasks..Cheers,Albert

title: RE: Nord Drum 3p - factory settings ?
post_content: Hello Albert and Wartaler,i would like to thank you very much to have spent time with my problems.Everything is right now.For guys and women who could have the same problems,Here are the good midi's parameters of the nord drum 3p :Lo : OnGL : 10CH : OfNT : 60Pc : SrCC : SrSENDHere are the midi set up parameters of the Nord beat (ios)Midi chanel : 10Best regardsKarl

title: Mono output
post_content: Hello,Is it possible to have a mono output on the Nord Drum 3P by only plugging the left output channel as it is the case for the Nord Electro for example ?I read that stereo outputs were specifically added to enhance the previous model but I'd like to keep the possibility to stay mono as well when needed.Thanks a lot for your feedback!Arno

title: RE: Mono output
post_content: Hi Arno,not a 3P owner but the manual says thatThe Nord drum 3P is a stereo instrument with separate signal paths for left and right audio channels., as also the associated pictures show,  so the only option seem to be to create one (or more) specific "Mono" Drum Kit(s) with all drums elements panned to L (or R).

title: RE: Mono output

post_content: I notice that I can send MIDI to my Roland TD-50 and if set to MIDI thru it passes MIDI to the Nord Drum P3.However if I send the MIDI first to the Nord Drum P3 it does not reach the TD-50.Is there a MIDI thru setting in the Nord Drum P3? title: RE: Nord Drum P3 - MIDI thru?
post_content: Hi willsud,No there is no MIDI thru on the 3p, and the mapping of the MIDI notes is global, so it cannot be saved per kit/program..Cheers,Albert

title: RE: Nord Drum P3 - MIDI thru?

title: Set Dynamics curve per pad?
post_content: Just picked up a new Nord Drum 3P. In the manual it says "Dy - Dynamics: There are six different dynamic response curves that can be individually applied to each of the channels."However, when I change this setting (shift + pad mode button twice, turning the selection dial), it changes it for all of the channels, and I can't seem to figure out a way to isolate the setting for one channel. The trig/mono lights for all of the channels turn green when I enter this setting mode.

title: RE: Set Dynamics curve per pad?
post_content: Hi Isoparmesan, welcome to the forum!Sorry for the late response. The manual does suggest it can be set per pad, I don't own the 3p, but perhaps I can help checking if it's a global setting or not.. When you have the dynamics parameter in your display, use the channel/pad selection buttons to check the parameter for a couple of pads, if they all have the same setting, select one channel, change the dyn parameter with the knob, then check the other channels/pads, if they now all show the new setting, the dynamic curve is set globally for all 6 channels..Hope this helps,Albert

title: RE: NORD DRUM 3P CUSTOM SOUND SHARING
post_content: Hi Takejazz2036,Indeed, the Drum 3 Manager allows you to transfer banks or drumkits from the 3p to your computer, or vice versa, you can download it here:https://www.nordkeyboards.com/software- ... -3-managerYou"ll need a MIDI interface, connect MIDI Out to In and In to Out, select the interface in the software, the software will let you know if it is connected to the 3p. More details in the 3p manual.Perhaps it's a good idea to transfer kits and banks that you created yourself to your computer first, just in case you accidentally overwrite them. On the Nord site you can find the factory sounds, but also the Albin and Axel banks:https://www.nordkeyboards.com/sound-lib ... ory-soundsNot a lot of banks there, nor here unfortunately, none for the 3p actually. Hopefully this will change!Cheers,Albert

title: Recording 3P midi to Modstep
post_content: I got my Nord Drum 3P a week ago, and I really like the sound and the quality of it. Also like the limitations – that it's not another MPC with tweakable samples in layers but an actual synth with its own character.I have used it with the Nord Beat app, works great. I have seen on different forums that people use the more advanced Modstep sequencer app, so I thought I'd give it a try.I do get midi in and out, meaning I can program the Nord from the Modstep, and when I hit the pads on the Nord I see the Modstep midi in react.But how do I actually record a midi sequence to the Modstep by playing the Nord Drum pads?I guess this might be more of a Modstep issue than a Nord Drum issue, but since I think some of you have figured it out, I put the question here anyway.Separate question: While I'm quite happy with the workaround of sequencing the kick drum with Nord Beat and playing the other pads by hand, I would like to know what other means of triggering through the Kick trig in there are, apart from an electronic kick drum pedal. Does it take a squarewave LFO?

title: RE: Recording 3P midi to Modstep
post_content: OK, problem solved: Track needs to be armed.

title: Another nord drum 3p editor / randomizer
post_content: This is an editor/randomizer I put together to make working with the 3p and a computer a bit easier. This editor run in max, but should work fine with the demo version. Make sure, in max, to set you midi device to 'a' in midi settings.This editor allows you to edit or randomize a single channel (pad) at a time. The circle buttons randomize the parameter. The randomize all button randomizes all the values for the selected channel (pad).Link to the editor:https://patchstorage.com/inductiveone-n ... andomizer/

title: Issue Triggering Nord Drum 3p thru Midi (Protools/Ableton)
post_content: I ve an issue triggering my Nord Drum 3p thru Midi with Ableton or Protools. I can record everything thru midi with no problem. But when i try to playback and trigger it plays more than one pad. (but the midi data is only one).For example: I record something on PAD 2. I play it back to the Nord. The Nord plays then PAD 1 and PAD 2 an PAD 6.Is there any one who can help me?And yes, I read the Manual, I read the Manuel of Protools and Ableton and all other Midi triggered Instruments work fine!I m using:PT 12Ableton 10OS X 10.13M-Audio Midisport 4x4but tried other Midiinterfaces for it.

title: RE: Issue Triggering Nord Drum 3p thru Midi (Protools/Ableton)
post_content: Hi bommel,Perhaps 2 or more drum channels share the same MIDI note in the 3p's MIDI settings, check the note (eg [nt.60]) for each of the 6 drum channels, they should all be different. title: Nord Drum 3p pad coming off
post_content: Two of my Nord Drum 3 pads are slightly lifting up on the corners. Can I just use super glue or some other adhesive and stick them back down? They still function fine, but I don’t want the problem to get worse. Any info or adhesive recommendations?

title: RE: Nord Drum 3p pad coming off
post_content: Easy fix. I used an epoxy mixture and then placed a heavy book on top of the the pads to keep pressure on them for several hours.

title: RE: Nord Drum 3p pad coming off
post_content: I just bought abrand newNord Drum 3p - and some of the pad edges were coming up (the glue was coming loose). I pressed them back down - and I'll try to leave something heavy on them tonight.. but they are coming back up. I could take it back... but - that seems like more work than just fixing it. Are these pads usually good for the life of the instrument - or do people replace them every few years? I wouldn't want to use the wrong glue - or use a serious epoxy that couldn't easily be removed. Any advice in that realm? : )

title: RE: Nord Drum 3p pad coming off
post_content: Just use an epoxy like I did. It came in two separate small tubes that you mix together on a plate or in a bowl. It doesn't take much at all. I used a pop cycle stick to lightly spread the epoxy and a toothpick for smaller crevices. Don't over do it and have the epoxy gushing out as it's hard to clean off...like I said it doesn't take much. Clean up your work and set a book on top of the pads for 24 hours. Worked great for me and the pads haven't lifted again.  The pads are not user replaceable as far as I know and I'm sure an epoxy was used to glue them down to begin with.

title: RE: I can't connect ND3p to Logic X
post_content: Hi there.OK, as I understand it, the Nord Drum 3P uses 6 midi channels for midi send / receive, so you need to have 6 separate midi tracks assigned to channels 1 through 6, if I'm right that is... Make sure you're using decent midi cables and they're going from the midi out of the drum 3p to the in of the interface also the out of the interface to the out of the drum 3p.audio signal, you send the main outs to your interface's track inputs and then create either a stereo audio channel using inputs 1 and 2 or 2 separate audio channels 1 and 2 depending on logical pan assignments on the drum 3p.I would have a look in the manual for midi settings if they apply. title: RE: I can't connect ND3p to Logic X
post_content: Hi ebenanthony,I'm not sure if you want to record audio, MIDI, or both, your Presonus has all of this on board so..If you want to record the audio of each drum sound (bass drum, hi-hats, snare etc) onto separate tracks, you'll have to do this one by one, the 3p only has 2 audio outputs, normally used for stereo. MIDI is not going help you here, well, not directly. MIDI is just data: which notes are played, at what velocity, etc. but no audio. One trick to record the audio of each part separately, may be to record your whole performance in MIDI first and then later play this MIDI back to record the audio for each part onto different audio tracks one by one.About the setup for recording MIDI:LewTheKeysGuy wrote:OK, as I understand it, the Nord Drum 3P uses 6 midi channels for midi send / receive, so you need to have 6 separate midi tracks assigned to channels 1 through 6, if I'm right that is...Actually, the simplest setup uses a single MIDI track with 1 MIDI channel,-The 'individual' MIDI channels of the 3p will not output any MIDI, they can only be used to control the 3p-make sure that the 'individual' MIDI channels of the 3p are either off [Ch.OF] or use different MIDI channels than the global MIDI channel, they should never overlap-In LogicX, setup a single MIDI track, use the 'global' MIDI channel of the 3p as output MIDI channel (and use the same MIDI channel if you have to manually set the input MIDI channel)-play the pads and record MIDI onto the track, if the recording doesn't work, double check if the global MIDI channel and the track MIDI channel match, check the cables and connections; IN goes to OUT, OUT goes to IN..-While recording, perhaps you'll have to switch off direct track monitoring in LogicX, to prevent that the incoming MIDI notes are sent right back to the 3p again, you can also use the 'local off' setting on the 3p, please check the manual for this..-Once you recorded the MIDI of your performance onto a MIDI track you can play the MIDI track and the 3p will start producing sound, you can change the drum set if you want to, and in Logic you can edit individual notes, quantize them etc.-If you want to isolate the parts, copy the MIDI notes for each part to different MIDI tracksHope some of this will help..Cheers,Albert

title: Connecting a keyboard to the kick drum tone
post_content: HiI want to go between triggering the kick drum tone simultaneously by using my keyboard to trigger notes on the kick drum in tune with the song, and also jump onto the pad and have it keep the same note I last played on the kayboard.But annoyingly it looks like it throws the whole pad off scale since it will no longer be set to note 60 if I use cc's to change the tone pitch once a note is triggered from my keyboard.Anyone found a way around this??

title: RE: Connecting a keyboard to the kick drum tone
post_content: Hi electrolegs!You can play melodies/bass lines using the Individual MIDI channel of your bass drum sound, but whenever you return playing the pad it will not continue with the last note you played on the keyboard. The Tone pitch setting (either with CCs or with the knob) determines the pitch which is applied when playing the pad, or note 60, ('central' C) on a keyboard. Playing other notes on the keyboard will not change the pitch setting itself.Perhaps with an app or device you can modify the MIDI coming from your keyboard, sending the right CCs to get the pitch for the corresponding note, combined with note 60 (regardless of which note originally played on the keyboard). Which may not be that easy to accomplish.Cheers,Albert

So I now have control of the pitch tone on the kick drums but the gotcha is that I need to filter all note info and only send the keyboard ccs. That now is great if I want to change the note on the keyboard and have it stay on the nord. However the problem is that it doesn't trigger the kick now on the keyboard. My workaround for now is to run out of my keyboard CV gate to the kick in which works, but I'm getting a trigger with both on and off notes. Ideally I can keep this in midiAny way to trigger a pad on the nord without using a note number?Best

title: RE: Connecting a keyboard to the kick drum tone
post_content: Hi,I don't know the capabilities of that box, but if you could also send note 60 regardless of which key you play, next to sending the CCs, it should work,Triggering with CV requires a spike shaped envelope, you'll need an envelope generator. Because with a gate/square/pulse type of signal on the input, it will be triggered when the voltage goes from 0v to 5v and again when it goes from 5v to 0v, unless the pulse is very short.Cheers,Albert

title: RE: Nord 3P / slave Midi connection with octatrack
post_content: Hi!Ok, I hope this will help:For drum patterns, use the Global channel, the default value for the global MIDI channel = 10 [GL.10]On your sequencer program a pattern using the 6 note numbers that are set for each of the 6 channels (sounds or ‘pads’ if you like) on the 3P in the MIDI menu ( [n.60], etc). Unless you want to control sound parameters with CCs, it’s best to leave the individual MIDI channels off [Ch.OF].The individual MIDI channels can be used to control sound parameters of the 6 channels of your 3P. And also allow you to play melodies, because MIDI notes that are sent to an individual MIDI channel will now control the pitch of the Tone section of the 3P.Example of CC control: Let’s say you created a snare sound on channel2, and you have a beat programmed on your sequencer. And now you want to gradually change the noise filter settings of the snare during the song. On channel2 select individual MIDI channel 2, find the right CC for noise filter in the manual, then program your sequencer to send the CC to MIDI channel 2 for the filter sweep, while the drum pattern itself is sent to MIDI channel 10 (global channel)Example of melodies: let’s say you created a xylophone sound on channel1, and selected individual MIDI channel 1 for that channel. If you now let your sequencer or keyboard send notes to MIDI channel 1 you will hear your xylophone sound playing the melody.. Remember: each of the 6 channels is monophonic, if you want to play chords on your synthetic xylophone, copy the same xylophone sound to the other channels, but use a different individual MIDI channel for each. Send the individual notes of the chord to these individual MIDI channels.In conclusion, for drum patterns, it’s easiest to use the global MIDI channel + the note numbers as set in the MIDI menu. It’s best to keep the individual MIDI channels off, unless you want to control the parameters of the individual sounds, or play melodies. And if you use them, in most cases you want to make sure that the individual MIDI channels are different from each other, - but always make sure the individual MIDI channels are all different from the global MIDI channel!Cheers,Albert

title: RE: Nord 3P / slave Midi connection with octatrack
post_content: Quai34 wrote:Nord-Drum-mer wrote:I think you need to set each channel to "off" to get them to use the global channel.Somewhat related, Octatrack has been the most satisfying gear purchase since ND1.Really, in what way? I'm looking for a drums machine/sampler etc for me so, could you elaborate a bit on this one?I doubt our needs and wants are the same, but Octatrack, like ND1, are two pieces of gear that not only perform the functions I bought them for, but also provide many more possibilities than the initial need, and when combined make each other stronger.OT can take one note from ND1 ( or anything for that matter ) and make any chord you wish. It will also allow sequencing and or looping of the ND1 via audio or MIDI. OT makes me think of getting ND2 or 3P for more realtime control. I added my voice to a "wish list" in this very forum shortly after getting ND1; I was pleased to see some of them implemented in the later versions.Happy to ramble on further, is there anything you wanted to discuss PM me or we can start a new thread so others can join the conversation.At this time, my idea of the perfect drum machine would be combining ND2 and Elektrons Analog Rhythm ii. Analog, Virtual Analog, a sequencer, trigger to midi convertor, effects, multiple outs, sampling and playback, and sound card capability.I'm" making do" with ND1, OT, & ARmki. Completely badass setup, I'm spoiled.

title: RE: Nord 3P / slave Midi connection with octatrack
post_content: Really late to this party but I thought I'd pitch in anyway since I'm using the same gear.The drum pad has a global midi channel which will activate each pad based off certain pitches (I believe it is C4, D4, E4, F4, G4, A4). Only use the global channel if you do not wish to send CC messages to the pad as it will have some interesting results but will probably not just cause more headaches.For more control over each pad set each pad to have it's own midi channel (in the midi settings use ChX to set each pads midi channel, cycle through the individual pads by using the channel select buttons near the top of the pad).I like to use midi channels 1-6 for each pad, I'll only use the global midi channel if I don't want to mess around with the individual pads sounds.Don't forget, to activate the CC controls from the OT you need to hold function and click the relevant encoder to turn it on, this kept causing me frustration when I forgot about it. Also, some CC messages can only be received over global channel such as delay rate and a a few others that affect all pads.Also, when using individual midi channels for each pad the default pitch is D4, the OTs default note value is set to C4 so if your programmed drums sound different to when you play the pad, that's possibly why.

title: RE: Nord 3p not responding to midi
post_content: Hi h4ndcrafted, welcome to the forum!That sounds strange, if you play back the same notes that you recorded, it should respond, that is if all is connected properly and cables are fine.Two things that I can think of:1) Is the 'Individual MIDI channel' switched off [Ch.OF] on each drum channel? If one or more happen to be on MIDI channel 10 as well, you may get some sort of conflict as the drum channel will be triggered twice at the same time while it's monophonic.. not sure if this results in no sound at all..2) MIDI note 60 corresponds with C3 or C4 depending on which standard is used; Yamaha or Roland. So when you're programming a drum pattern in a sequencer, you should perhaps try both octaves..Cheers,Albert

title: RE: Nord 3p not responding to midi

title: RE: Nord 3p not responding to midi
post_content: You tried 2 different hardware devices to send MIDI data, you checked that MIDI channel and notes match (or even better, used MIDI notes that were recorded from your 3p) I can't think of anything else to be honest..

title: RE: Nord 3p not responding to midi
post_content: More options...First make sure that other MIDI hardware is detected by using:a MIDI testerhttp://practicalusage.com/midi-experime ... di-tester/or a MIDI monitor programThen try the Nord.

title: RE: Nord 3p not responding to midi
post_content: I agree,There is no 100% guarantee that if a USB-MIDI interface works with some gear, it will work with all, but I've heard of such inconsistencies mostly with the cheaply made ones. I don't know the Roland one, but I think their hardware is usually of reasonable, if not good quality. However, I can be mistaken, and/or yours could be malfunctioning, so I agree with Mr G., it's always good to double check your hardware and cables and/or try other interfaces/hardware. (nice diy test device suggestion btw.). You also had no luck with the Pioneer SP16 sequencer, it's a good idea to test the SP16 (and the MIDI cable) with other gear, if you hadn't already..Regardless which hardware setup you use, the MIDI notes that you're sending should match with the ones set in the 3p MIDI settings (usually 60, 62, etc.) Since there may be some confusion about the octave, it's a good idea to double check if you're not one octave off, that's when MIDI monitoring software can be very handy, connect the MIDI out of your SP16 to the IN of your MIDI interface, and see what the SP16 is actually sending, and if it actually arrives at the other end of the MIDI cable.If you checked all that, and there is no problem there, and the Nord still does not respond, I would contact your dealer/distributor to have it checked..Cheers,Albert

title: RE: Nord 3p not responding to midi

title: Can I transfer wav files to my nord drum 1?
post_content: Hello I'm new to midi dumps and if possible would like to dump some 80s wav samples into my nord drum 1 but I don't have any idea how to go about doing this. Is there any way I can do this? Also what programs will I need? I have windows 10

title: RE: Can I transfer wav files to my nord drum 1?
post_content: No, that is not possible, none of the Nord drum models can load samples, it's 100% synthesis..You can try to replicate the 80s drum sounds by tweaking the parameters..

title: RE: Can I transfer wav files to my nord drum 1?
post_content: Good Morning,If I understand the manual correctly, the MIDI dump functionality on the ND1 is specifically for installing OS updates (latest v1.08) and restoring the SysEx Factory Bank (latest v1.04 revA). You can find the OS updates, the FSB, and the manual at the link below. I hope this was helpful!https://www.nordkeyboards.com/downloads/nord-drumThank you,DavevaD

title: RE: Can I transfer wav files to my nord drum 1?
post_content: Hi Dave,Yes, it is possible to transfer data to the Nord drum with sysex MIDI dumps, but as you say, in case of the Nord drum, that is only to transfer banks, programs or operating systems, not for samples or other digital audio, the Nord drum does not support sample playback.Cheers,Albert

My other gear works so I don't think it's on the sequencer side. Does anyone have any ideas? I feel so stupid.Thank you

title: RE: ND 1 No response to midi notes in DAW
post_content: if you are getting the unit to respond to incoming midi from another device and not from the DAW, that would seem to indicate that the issue is on the DAW sidesounds like a channel mismatch situation -- set up your DAW to mirror your MPD32's settings

title: RE: ND 1 No response to midi notes in DAW
post_content: Thank you for the reply! I am having the same issue in Reason 10 using channel one both in Reason and on the ND. Here are my settings on the ND: C 1, LOF, POF. I have a MIDI cable patched from the MIDI out from my audio interface to the MIDI in of the ND. I can hear audio from the ND on an audio track in Reason when I press the TRIG button but not from the piano roll. The only way I was able to use the MPD32 was with MIDI learn. However, MIDI learn did not work with Reason's piano roll.

title: RE: ND 1 No response to midi notes in DAW
post_content: Hi,The MIDI channel has to match, the MIDI notes too. Maybe something went wrong with MIDI learn. Therefore, verify the notes and correct them manually if required; if the ND is set to respond to incoming note numbers 60, 62, 64, 65, for drum channels 1-4 resp. (check the note for each of the 4 drum channels in MIDI settings) the drum pattern on the MIDI track of your DAW has to comprise of those 4 notes. With mentioned note numbers, that's: C3, D3, E3 and F3, (or, depending on which standard your DAW uses, perhaps: C4, D4, E4, F4).If you have multiple MIDI interfaces, or more outputs on your interface, check if you selected the right one as MIDI output device for your MIDI track, and double check if you indeed connected the output port of your MIDI interface to the input of your ND, and perhaps also try another MIDI cable.Cheers,Albert

title: RE: ND 1 No response to midi notes in DAW
post_content: Hi All,I finally got it to work with Reason 10 (I imagine one would have similar results in another DAW). Instead of using the MIDI out on my UMC404HD, I used an old M-Audio UNO MIDI. The settings on the ND under MIDI CH are: C1, L0n, P5. I set the MIDI NOTE for ch 1-4 to 60, 62, 64, 65. I penciled in the corresponding notes in Reasons' piano roll and it worked!Thank you all so much!09.24.19 Addendum: I should also note that both the MIDI input and MIDI output had to be connected for this to work. When I removed the cable from the MIDI output this fix stopped working.

title: Low Output Signal
post_content: I recently purchased a used Nord Drum and there is barely any audio output. I have the volume knob on the unit maxed out, the input gain on my audio interface maxed out, and the headphone volume on my audio interface maxed out. The output is barely audible. I have tried different inputs, headphones, and cables. I updated the OS and reinstalled the SysEx factory sound bank but I am still having the issue. From what I can tell (after reading the manual and playing with it for a bit) the unit is otherwise functioning properly. Any suggestions?

title: RE: Low Output Signal
post_content: I figured it out. It wasn't the unit after all. I had a compressor plugged into the inserts of my audio interface. The compressor was shut off and for whatever reason, it was attenuating any audio signals routed through the inputs of the audio interface. Once I removed the connections from the inputs, I could hear the Nord Drum. Thank you!

title: RE: Nord Drum 3p with Logic Pro X can't connect
post_content: Hi Cody,When you hit a pad, the 3p sends a MIDI note on the Global MIDI channel,You can check the Global MIDI channel and which pads (channel 1-6) are coupled to which notes in the MIDI settings,Press shift + MIDI to go through the MIDI settings, see page 12 of the manual for details,In Logic make sure that you couple 6 drum sounds to these 6 notes, and the virtual instrument is listening to the global MIDI channel (or Omni = all) the 3p is sending the notes on.Hope this helps,Albert

title: Using Nord Drum 3p with Deepmind6 & Minibrute 2s
post_content: Hi,My set-up now includes a deepmind6 & Arturia minibrute 2s which i've recently acquired.I've been jammin with the deep6 and 2S by MIDI syncing them but have yet to try syncing with the Nord also.School boy question coming... If I use The 2S as the master (Out to Deep6 In, then deep6 thru to Nord) will that enable me to use the FX of the Deep6 and the 2S to manipulate the Nord Drums sounds??Pardon me if my question is not so clear.Any info on this if you have used other synths to manipulate the Nords sounds.Thanks

title: RE: Using Nord Drum 3p with Deepmind6 & Minibrute 2s
post_content: Hi,Perhaps I misinterpreted your question, but MIDI can only be used to control instruments; digital instructions are transmitted from a keyboard, controller, or sequencer, to a synth, soundmodule, etc. which then follow these instructions, and produce sound, change parameters etc. These MIDI instructions usually include note number, velocity, and MIDI channel, but no information about what sort of sound the synth or soundmodule should produce.MIDI clock can be used to synchronise the speed/rate of sequences, arpeggiators or effects, between instruments, sequencers or effect units. MIDI clock is transmitted without a MIDI channel, all instruments in the chain will receive the same clock. I think the BPM of the delay of the 3p can be synced to a sequencer in this way, not 100% sure though.There is no digital or analog audio passed through with MIDI. So if you want to apply audio effects on the Nord Drum 3p sounds with the deep6, or minibrute 2s, you need to route the audio from the 3p outputs to the inputs of the deep6 and/or minibrute, using instrument (jack-jack) cables.Your MIDI setup seems correct to control both deep6 and 3p with the minibrute 2s, to prevent that both deep6 and 3p respond to the same MIDI instructions, choose a different MIDI channel for each of the 2 instruments, I don't know the sequencing capabilities of the minibrute 2s.Hope this helps,Cheers,Albert

title: RE: Using Nord Drum 3p with Deepmind6 & Minibrute 2s
post_content: Thank you Albert,That's cleared that up for me and I look forward to trying this tonight.Also if you have a minute?I've got patterning running on my ipad and have midi configured it so it plays my 3P sounds.I'm finding it very difficult to have patterning sync with the minibrute clock.I am I missing something in Patterning that will enable me to do this?Thanks

title: RE: Using Nord Drum 3p with Deepmind6 & Minibrute 2s
post_content: Hi,It is slightly off topic, and I'm no expert in Patterning, nor on the 2s, I'll give it a shot anyway,You have to have a MIDI connection from the MIDI out of your clock source (2s), to the MIDI input of the MIDI interface that is connected to your iPad. Make sure the 2s is transmitting MIDI Clock. Then in the app, go to the File tab, tap on the clock under Sync, and enable clock receive, your MIDI interface should be listed there, select it. I think that should do the trick. If not, perhaps check the Patterning community/forum/turorials/manual..I'm curious: Could you please check if the 3p Delay tempo responds to the clock of the 2s? I can't find anything about clock sync in the manual, (it could be because my brain is slowly starting to boil, unusually high temperatures here in the Netherlands right now)Cheers,Albert

title: Digitakt and Nord Drum 2 individual midi
post_content: HiAnyone using Nord Drum 2/3 with Elektron Digitakt? I have some problems I want to solve.ND 2 can use 6 indivual midi channels and an global (set to 10). Digitakt have 8 midi tracks that can be assigned to external gear. I send midi to my Bass station 2 (ch7) and a Volca Kick (ch16) without any problem.For some reason the I can't send midi to Nord Drum 2.I have checked the Nord Drum2 manual (p. 10-11, 29-31) for midi settings, both global and individual.My settings are:Nord Drum 2Global Midi 10Indv. Midi Ch.Ch1=10 (n60),Ch2=11 (n62)Ch3=12 (n64)Ch4=13 (n65)Ch5=14 (n67)Ch5=15  (n69)DigitaktMidi A=Ch10Midi B=Ch11Midi C=Ch12etcetcAny help would be of great help!Thanks!

title: RE: Digitakt and Nord Drum 2 individual midi
post_content: Hi EricDeluxe,Does the ND2 receive any MIDI? What goes wrong exactly?First (and only) thing I noticed is that you are using MIDI channel 10 both as Global and as Individual MIDI channel for channel 1, avoid any overlap between Global and Individual MIDI channels.-I think you only need the Global MIDI channel, switch all Individual MIDI channels off, [Ch.OF], make a drum pattern using the 6 notes in a single track on the DT with MIDI channel 10 (/the Global MIDI channel).-If you want a dedicated track on the DT for each drum sound, which allows you to control pitch and sound parameters with CC's, use the Individual MIDI channels. Any note sent on an Individual MIDI channel will trigger a drum sound on the corresponding drum channel of the ND2, with MIDI note 60, the pitch will be the same as set with the Pitch parameter. If you choose to use the Individual MIDI channels, and given your setup, either pick a different Global MIDI channel, or switch off the Global MIDI channel [GL.OF].Hope this helpsAlbert

OFPC SrCC Sr

title: RE: Nord Drum 2 controlled by Patterning
post_content: Hi Fatal laughter,Go into the Midi configuration tab in patterning, select the first track, then where it says midi port - irig midi - select the arrow to the right then select patterning. Do this for all 6 tracks then nord drum should receive midi.

title: RE: Nord Drum 2 controlled by Patterning
post_content: skintechnician wrote:Hi Fatal laughter,Go into the Midi configuration tab in patterning, select the first track, then where it says midi port - irig midi - select the arrow to the right then select patterning. Do this for all 6 tracks then nord drum should receive midi.This is how it's done, though there's some settings required on the Nord Drum as well; individual MIDI channels (and not the global channel) on all six tracks need to be (as far as I see and hear..) set to, say, 1 thru 6, then you need to set the six tracks in Patterning that you want to drive the Nord Drum with to the corresponding channels, in this example, 1 thru 6. title: RE: Nord Drum 2 controlled by Patterning
post_content: Hi,With the above suggestion to select 'Patterning' as MIDI device, I didn't get the app to output any MIDI.Setting up MIDI in Patterning:-'MIDI configuration' can be found under the 'File' tab,-under 'MIDI track output' you can switch the MIDI output of each of the 8 tracks on/off,-select 'on' if you want a track to output MIDI,-then tap on the text 'Port...' next to the on/off switch, a new menu appears,-there, under 'MIDI port', select your USB-MIDI interface (!)-under 'MIDI channel', select the MIDI channel that corresponds with the Global MIDI channel on the Nord Drum, (usually 10)-under 'Pitch', select the MIDI note that corresponds with the drum channel of the Nord drum that you want to couple to that track, note 'C4' here corresponds with note number 60The only thing I don't understand is how to silence a track in Patterning, with mute MIDI is also stopped (logically), I can't seem to suppress the drum sounds of the app itself.. apart from muting my iPad speakers, but it would be nice to combine Nord drum and internal sounds, perhaps create an empty (silent) drum sample.. or am I missing something?Cheers,Albert

post_content: Hi, what do you want to record exactly, audio or MIDI (or both)?How do you connect the NP3 to the Mac?Take a look at this thread too (it is for NE5 but it would be the same for NP3)post111395.html

title: RE: Nord 3P and Logic
post_content: kicksnarebeats wrote:i'm looking to record both however definitely more audio from the nord than midi. i am connecting the nord to my mac with a mio connectivity adapter. i'll be sure to check out that thread as well.The mio connectivity adapter isMIDIonly! No audio will be transmitted over that device.If you want to record audio, you have to use/buy an (external)audio interface.Check this videofor an explanation......and then check theFAQon that:How can I record my Nord into any/a daw?This depends what you would like to record:MidiMIDI has nothing to do with audio. It is ONLY the information about what is played and when, but there is no sound transfer. It is to audio as Sheet music is to a CD. Sheet music contains all the information about what’s on the CD, but it doesn’t contain any sound itself (as said by Analogika).When recording midi (notes) you will need to connect your Nord to your Mac/PC with an USB cable or MIDI interface using the MIDI DIN connection. Depending on the Nord model, it's supporting MIDI over USB (or not). In the DAW (of your choice) you have to create a MIDI channel strip and configure it to listen for MIDI data on the configured MIDI port.AudioAudio can be recorded on your Mac/PC using the onboard microphone connection (not recommended) or an audio interface (external audio card). You have to connect the L/R audio output of your Nord device to this audio interface. In the DAW (of your choice) you have to create a AUDIO channel strip and configure this to the configured audio input on your audio interface where you Nord instrument is connected to.Gr Bart

title: RE: Nord 3P and Logic
post_content: kicksnarebeats wrote:so if it's just using the regular L and R out, which type of cable is it that'd you have to use? between patch, microphones and instrument cables it's a bit confusing. would you use a microphone cable with a TRS Male 1/4 input and then an XLR Male to go into the focusrite?Keep it simple, you just need 2 standard "mono" (unbalanced) jack cables between NP3 OUT 1/2 and the audio interface inputs 1 and 2, same cables you use to connect the NP3 to a mixer or to speakers, that's it. title: RE: Nord Beat 3 app & Nord Drum 3P........Difficulties
post_content: Hi Takejazz2036!In MIDI Devices menu select the iConnect interface as output device, the rest of your setup seems correct, you have to make sure you connect the OUT connector of the iConnect to the MIDI IN of your 3p-Clock Sync can be used to synchronise external devices with the tempo of the app, or let the app be a slave to external clock and start/stop triggers (that's why the play button disappears if you select receive), select Off, you don't need that if you just want the 3p to play your drum patternsIf you programmed a pattern in the app and then press play, you should see channel light blinking and hear drum soundsCheers,Albert

title: RE: Nord Beat 3 app & Nord Drum 3P........Difficulties
post_content: Hi,If you open the MIDI settings in the app, you'll see a list of MIDI note numbers, a different one for each of the 6 drum channels. These are the MIDI notes that will be sent on the MIDI channel that you have set in the app (usually 10) once you press play, or play the pads in the app.Now on the 3p, press Shift + MIDI a couple of times until you see [nt.xx] where xx is the note number that is set for that drum channel, use the channel selection buttons to check which note number is set for each drum channel, if the note numbers do not correspond to the ones listed in the app, use the knob to match them, (alternatively change them in the app so that they match with the 3p). The factory defaults are note 60 (central C) for drum channel 1, note 62 for drum channel 2, 64 for #3, 65 for #4, 67 for #5, 69 for #6. It doesn't matter which note numbers you choose, as long as they match with the app..The 3p only responds to these 6 MIDI notes received on the Global MIDI channel, if you send other notes to the 3p, or use a different MIDI channel than the Global MIDI channel, the 3p won't do anything.Hope this helps!Albert

title: RE: Nord Beat 3 app & Nord Drum 3P........Difficulties
post_content: Hmm, that sounds strange, so you set note number 60 for drum channel 1, (the LED of drum channel 1 was lit), then pressed the > channel select button to go to drum channel 2 (and checked the LED of drum channel 2 is lit) set it to [nt.62], then go back to drum channel 1 with the < drum channel select button, the display then says [nt.62] ?! There is no special procedure to save those settings, they are stored automatically, that is, you do have to Exit the menu before switching off the unit, that's all..

title: RE: Nord Beat 3 app & Nord Drum 3P........Difficulties
post_content: Hi,No, audio should be coming from your 3p, not your iPad,The idea is that the app sends instructions to your 3p in the form of MIDI, via the iConnect MIDI interface, the 3p then follows these instructions and produces drum sounds, so you should connect headphones to your 3p, or connect your 3p to an amp or mixer ..Cheers,Albert

title: RE: Nord Beat 3 app & Nord Drum 3P........Difficulties
post_content: Well, I think all relevant MIDI settings in the app and 3p should be ok now; Global MIDI channel + the MIDI notes match, the other settings in the 3p will not affect the interaction with the app-The black MIDI connector (MIDI OUT) of the iConnect should be plugged into the MIDI IN of the 3p, perhaps try the white one, just in case they are mislabeled-Does your 3p produce any sound when you hit the pads of the 3p itself?-Is there a drum pattern in the app (red/orange/yellow squares)?-If you press play in the app, do you see the green step indicator move from left to right through the steps?-In the app, on the top left, the velocities can be set for the red, orange and yellow steps, they should be larger than 0 to hear anything.. Just to test your setup, perhaps raise all three to 127If it still doesn't work, perhaps your iConnect it defective, or your 3p MIDI IN port, it's difficult to tell since you don't have any other synths or samplers with MIDI to test with..Albert

title: RE: Nord Drum 2 and Cubase
post_content: Hi microgroove,The fact that you are hearing a drum sound which pitch depends on the MIDI note played tells me that at least one of the 6 drum channels has it's Individual MIDI channel on. So check the Individual MIDI channel for each drum channel, and select [Ch.OF].Make sure that each drum channel has a unique MIDI note in the MIDI settings, eg [n.60] for channel 1, [n.62] for channel 2, etc. The default order is: 60,62,64,65,67,69, that's the white keys on a piano, starting with C3 or C4 depending on which standard is used (Yamaha or Roland). Play/Program/record a drum pattern with these notes.Hope this helpsAlbert

title: RE: Nord Drum 2 and Cubase
post_content: Thanks Albert I'll check that.

title: RE: Changing banks on ND2 using Octatrack
post_content: Hi Korhan,I don't know if it's possible to send pairs of LSB and MSB (Least Significant, and Most Significant Byte) control changes (CC's) with the Octatrack, bank select requires a combination of CC's 0 (MSB) and 32 (LSB), transmit the LSB value first, then the MSB value.Hope this helps,Albert

title: RE: Changing banks on ND2 using Octatrack
post_content: I encountered this while sequencing Yamaha gear with OT. Use two CC's on OT configurable CC page and set them to MSB and LSB.I can't test this since I have ND1, but it works fine for all my other Yamaha and EMU gear.

title: RE: Nord Drum 3p is very noisy
post_content: My question, and what many of us have is:Are the problems that I and others have experienced a result of some faulty batch, or are they inherit to the reverb engine and the design of the unit?This is important to know in order to make informed decisions about purchasing the unit or not.I think it is also important to provide specific examples, as the concept of "noise" can be very vague. I will try to do so here.To recap, I identify three problems:Issue 1:The constant hiss of the headphone output. The hiss begins when the unit is turned on, irrespective of settings, and does not respond to the master volume level. It is just there, constant and ever-present. In contrast, the line outputs in my unit are clean.Issue 2:The noise present when any type of reverb is on, even on its lowest settings. The crackling noise will begin immediately when the pads are hit, and it decays slower than the reverb trail. The sound from the line outputs is otherwise crystal clear when the reverb is off.Description of attached examples:These non-dithered .wav files were recorded directly in my Focusrite Scarlett 6i6, straight from the line outs. I made sure that the volume settings on the unit was around 3/4th of max, and the interface preamp levels low (2/5ths of their range), making sure there was no clipping or distortion occurring. I used the factory preset of pad 4, in Drum Kit A1.Nord3P_NoReverb.wavA high-velocity hit, with the reverb turned off. To my ears, it is crystal-clear.(750.04 KiB) Downloaded 367 timesNord3P_Reverb.wavA high-velocity hit, with the reverb turned on, to the default type (P3) and value of 9 (out of 50). Might be hard to hear the noise, but should become obvious in higher volumes.(1.46 MiB) Downloaded 336 timesNord3P_Reverb_LowVelocity.wavA low velocity hit, same settings as in file 2.(1.78 MiB) Downloaded 270 timesNord3P_Reverb_LowVelocity_boost.wavSame as file 3, but with a +12 db boost in its channel in Ableton. Turning the volume up, you should be able to hear how bad the S/N ratio actually is, and how long the decay of the noise.(1.78 MiB) Downloaded 288 timesIssue 3:The reverb in general accumulates a lot of hiss and noise in some patches, to an unacceptable degree in some cases. Here is the description of a patch demonstrating this:Noise levels set to 0. Click levels set to 0. In the Tone section, set Wave to D2, Freq to 0, Decay to 36, Bend to 26, Time to 50 and Pitch set to 70.6. Distortion, EQ, Delay, and all effects turned off. Reverb type set to Hall, and value 20.I attach sounds of the patch with and without reverb. For comparison, I also ran the dry signal through the hall algorithm of my TC Electronics HoF reverb pedal at maximum decay time, levels and tone.Nord3P_Patch_NoReverb.wav(2.01 MiB) Downloaded 298 timesNord3P_Patch_Reverb.wav(2.31 MiB) Downloaded 308 timesNord3P_Patch_HoF.wav(3.39 MiB) Downloaded 265 timesThe bottom line is:Can you verify that you experience the same problems or that you can replicate the noise described here and demonstrated in the attached examples? We will then see how to take it from there.

It is noisy, however I would describe it more as grainy. It is the same characteristics as low bitrate reverbs: a grainy sound with "stale" or undynamic components, the noise level won't rise or fall as the reverb sound rises and fades out, instead it is the same level all the time.

title: amplifing nord drum on stage
post_content: Hi everyone,I'd like to buy an amplifier or an active monitor that I can use when playing live as I don't want to rely on all the different monitor systems at different venues, also sometimes I play in small clubs where there are no monitors, also would like to use it at my rehearsal place. Sometimes I use my Nord Drum along with acoustic drumset so I'd need some volume capacity, also something that can deliver the lows and highs. I was thinking in guitar or keyboard amps, though I know it'd colour the sound. Or should I go for an active speaker / monitor? Any advice, experience, specific modell recommendations would be greatly appreciated.thanks, Andras

title: RE: amplifing nord drum on stage
post_content: Our drummer plays through electronic drums (not Nord), and it was a challenge getting them to sound good.  Forget cheap stuff, guitar amps and keyboard amps -- be prepared to spend some money and move larger cabinets.You will want a decent speaker size (12" or more) to handle the bass, and a large amount of peak watts to handle transients.  Or, alternatively, a smaller speaker size / less power coupled with a small subwoofer.I have had success with the following setups:2x QSC K12.22x QSC K8.2 + RCF sub2x RCF TT08a + RCF sub2x RCF EVOX J8By the way, these configurations aren't just for the drums, they're for the whole band including drums.  You may also want a small mixer.Best of luck!

title: RE: amplifing nord drum on stage
post_content: thanks a lot!

title: RE: amplifing nord drum on stage
post_content: What cpholis said is right on point. Using wedge monitors will probably be your best bet.My band started off with Mackie Thumps, but they weren't the greatest. Our second set of wedge monitors are EV ELX115Ps. They're not cheap, but they sound great!Now we all usein-ear monitors, and I think they are far superior to wedges.

title: NORD DRUM 2 & ELECTRIBE 2
post_content: Hi guysI just got my Korg Electribe 2 and was immediately trying to hook it up with the ND2 ( so triggering sounds in the ND from the E2).That works perfectly fine intially, but two weird problems:- Pad 1 on the E2 triggers Ch1 on the ND, as it should be. But Pad 10 also triggers that same channel? Ch1 is the only one that weirdly gets triggered by two pads.- There is no velocityeven when I adjust velocity on the E2 and adjust the Threshold and Sensitivity ob the ND2, the signal is quite weak, so no dynamics.Has anybody used that same setup yet and might know what the issies are?Best, Sven

title: RE: NORD DRUM 2 & ELECTRIBE 2
post_content: Hi Sven!Nice combination E2 and ND2!It don't know the E2, only from youtube, I'll give it a shot anyway..The simplest explanation is that your E2 outputs the same MIDI note with pad #10 as with pad #1The problem could be more complex, it depends a bit on how flexible you can program MIDI settings on the E2, I didn't look that up..I'd first check the MIDI settings of your E2, check which note is set for pad #10 and compare this with the note set for pad #1. If it's the same, alter the note set for pad #10.If that wasn't the problem, I wonder if the MIDI output channel can be set per pad on the E2..If so, check if the MIDI output channel of pad #10 is different than the rest, change it, and/or do the following:On the ND2 switch off all the inividual MIDI channels; for each channel find this parameter under MIDI settings, and make sure they're all set to [Ch.OF] (unless you really want to use this feature to eg adjust parameters, note pitches per Channel)The velocity curve/sensitivity/threshold settings on the ND2 only apply for drum pads connected directly to the ND2,It must be on the E2 side, also a MIDI setting perhaps, -but are the pads velocity sensitive to start with?Hope this helps..Albert

title: how do i know which sound is set to a certain channel on 3p?
post_content: Hi Guys,I just can't find a way to find out in which bank any certain channel sound is stored. When I hit the pad and curious to know, where that sound is stored, what I see after selecting "drum select" is -- --any solution for this?thanks, Andras

title: RE: how do i know which sound is set to a certain channel on 3p?
post_content: Hi Andras,With 'drum select' a drum sound can becopiedfrom the drum bank to the channel of the drum kit you're editing. So it is not a reference to that drum sound in the drum banks but a copy, that you can then use and/or freely edit.-The drum bank is a pool of both factory and user made drum sounds. It makes it easy to reuse a drum sound in other drum kits. I usually start new drum sounds from scratch, but when I want to reuse a drum sound on the ND2, I have to go to the drum kit that has that specific sound, press copy, go all the way back to the kit I was working on and press paste. With the 3p you can do the same, but it is much easier to store drum sounds that you really like into the drum banks for later use.-When you press the 'select drum' button, the 3p waits until you rotate the dial to select a drum sound from the drum banks that will replace the drum sound that is currently in the channel of the drum kit you're in.-The 3p does not keep track from which drum bank a drum sound in a kit originated, partly because you are free to completely alter the sound once it is in the channel of the kit. If you are unhappy with the editting you did on the sound, you can always recall the original from the drum bank.Hope this answered your question..Albert
