title: ND2: 808 cowbell?
post_content: Anyone here know how to make an 808 cowbell with the Nord Drum 2?

title: RE: ND2: 808 cowbell?
post_content: With OS v3.00, use the A5 waveform (highpass filtered square) and set the initial pitch to something aproximate to 587Hz and then detune the second oscillator tosomething aproximate of 845hz using the spectra parameter. Use timbre to dampen the higher frequencies in order to achive the bandpass-filter of the 808 cowbell.You'll get some good hints here:http://www.soundonsound.com/sos/Sep02/a ... rets09.asp

title: polyphony
post_content: hi, I had my Nord Drum 2 for a few days only and I am having polyphony problems, can the polyphony be changed? I have midi'd up'd my Nord Drum to Ableton Live, have assigned  each pad to an individual midi track, but I can only play a note at once!, the note in the last pad/channel added prevails over the previous one when played at the same time.

title: RE: polyphony
post_content: Hi!The ND2 has 6 Channels, each can have a totally different sound. Each individual Channel is monophonic but the 6 Channels can produce sound independently of each other & at the same time. That is, unless a Mute group is active; Channels within this Mute group exclude each other. So, first make sure that you're trying to address different Channels of the ND2, and that there's no Mute group active..  See page 14 of the manual for details on Mute group..[Note how I write the word Channel with capital C to refer to one or more of the 6 Channels of the ND2, to avoid confusion with MIDI channels...]See pages 24, 29 and 30 for what you can do with MIDI..Another thing: somecheapMIDI interfaces are badly made / bad QC, resulting in specimens that for some weird reason won't allow more than one note be played at the same time. I know it sounds a bit strange but you wouldn't be the first..Here are some threads about MIDI and things that can go wrong with hardware and MIDI setups:http://www.norduserforum.com/nord-drum- ... t6063.htmlhttp://www.norduserforum.com/nord-drum- ... t7085.htmlhttp://www.norduserforum.com/nord-drum- ... t7095.htmlHere's how to make a 6 voice polyphonic synth of your ND2 - requires a computer:http://www.norduserforum.com/nord-drum- ... t7046.htmlCheers,Albert

title: RE: polyphony
post_content: Ok,I said 'cheap' MIDI interfaces in previous posts - I did some more googling - and not surprisingly - price isn't a good indicator per se -A USB-MIDI 'cable' (interface) mentioned on the internet (and also in this forum) causing problems for some people, is the Hosa Tracklink, apparently roughly the same price as my E-MU Xmidi 1x1 ..I also heard some negative stories about more expensive interfaces that were supplied with 'propriety drivers' that didn't work properly, and never got an update -So, try to find some reviews, make sure it's easy to return the item when faulty - etc etcI never know whether to trust statistics of user reviews etc.Perhaps there are millions of Hosa users - and only those few who had a faulty one took the effort to write a review.However, the problem with this Hosa seems very similar each time: when it fails, it still seems to work to some degree, but it blocks simultaneous notes being transmitted, and sometimes skips notes, ..I can only find positive reviews about mine, and I am happy with them too, but...Albert

title: RE: polyphony
post_content: Hi,apart from the results with the Win PC + USB hub (in general I think hubs should be avoided) it seems to confirm my idea, strange... perhaps a shared component, little chip that doesn't work in combination with apple devices?!Anyway, my E-MU 1x1 works 100% ok with my iPad1 + camera connection kit + Nord beat 2 app playing all 6 notes simultaneously if I want...

title: RE: polyphony
post_content: Some things I've read on the net I wanted to share:Interfaces (like mine) that do not require driver installation rely on the standard drivers of the computer's operating system, theoretically with every new version of the operating system there is a risk they stop working properly. Microsoft recently fixed an issue with Win8.1 where some USB MIDI interfaces didn't work properly when connected to USB3 ports. So there could also be some specific compatibility issues with Apple products with some MIDI interfaces..I have no deep knowledge of MIDI interfaces and their electronics, but I think the guys here do:http://www.arvydas.co.uk/2013/07/cheap- ... -required/I think the conclusion is this: possibly to reduce production costs, some manufactures started simplifying the design of their USB-MIDI interfaces, making them non-compliant with MIDI standards, and incompatible with some (but not all!) MIDI devices (they tested it with synths)..  I have an older version of the E-MU Xmidi 1x1, that works like a charm, but who knows the current version also contains this cheap wiring. [EDIT: the new ones work excellent !!]Some interfaces require special drivers provided by the manufacturers, how well they work depends on how well these drivers are written and kept up to date. I've also heard, and read some negative stories about some big brand expensive interfaces in this regard..many people here seem to have problems with their MIDI interfaces and some of the problems I think have to do with crappy quality and design.. Perhaps Nord could add MIDI over USB in a future ND modelAlbert

title: RE: Place to trade Nord Drum 2 kits/banks?
post_content: Hi Rhombus,And welcome to this forum.  You will notice that program sharing pages exist here for samples and Stages, but not Electros.  This is not to discriminate against Electro owners -- it is simply the case that historically there has been no interest in trying to share Electro programs, Electro programs being rather simple affairs.  Recently someone came along motivated to try to set up an Electro program library and after much back and forth commenting from many members it eventually came to this (condensed version): at the present time there does not seem to be sufficient interest in creating a whole new library for Electro programs, so attaching them to threads will be the way to go for now.  The issue can be revisited if/when the trafficking of these things begins to show more volume.It would seem likely that the same will be the case for the ND2.  There seems to be little need for a seperate library at the present time, but this may change over time.  With so many banks already available from Nord, perhaps many users are using existing sounds.  Also perhaps the ones who are taking the time/trouble to do much custom programming are feeling protective of their work and not up for sharing.Bless,Pablo

title: RE: Place to trade Nord Drum 2 kits/banks?

title: Alternative phase invert problem
post_content: I love my nord drum machine a lot! but last time when i did the midi tracking, i find that the phase will invert each time the midi triggered it... for example, on the kick drum, the "tone (or wave)" will be like + - + - + - + - ... and the "click" will be + + - - + + - - ....  thus create a more "humanized" sound, might be good in some way, which is quite annoying for me, while i need the kick to be consistently the same... thus i tracked one single kick and pasted it over and over...Is there a setting that i can fix this? please help!!!

title: RE: Alternative phase invert problem
post_content: Interesting!So, you say each time you trigger your bass sound the wave inverts phase,your 'click' sound also alternates phase but in a different order/patternSo I guess when the two sounds are layered, the problem then becomes cancellation in a particular pattern?do the sounds (waves) always start at phase zero?does it matter which tempo you play?it is not a setting, I think,I'm not an expert on synths, or drum synths, I don't know if it's intended,- no idea how the 'old-school' machines behaved in this respect for example,unless someone else here does have an idea about this, maybe you can ask Clavia themselves?Best,Albert

title: RE: Alternative phase invert problem
post_content: Yes I have the same problem. I tried to layer 3 sounds to make a massive house kick but it seems the sounds blend together due to invert phase and the kick is indeed not consistent. Has anybody contact nord about this or do they read this forum?Luc

title: RE: Alternative phase invert problem
post_content: Hi,I also recorded the Nord Drum, it gave me the opportunity to experiment a bit and look at the phase behavior;I recorded one channel (one sound) with just tone (no noise or click) with a slow decay.Using the trigger button, I played notes quickly following each other, and also some notes with more time in between, ...then I looked at the recorded signal in my DAW.I noticed that when you trigger a new sound while the previous is still sounding, the phase of the previous sound will be the starting point of the new sound.A sample will always be exactly the same, same start, same end, regardless of when you trigger it, but this is not a sampler obviously,Here is my 'hypothesis'  : perhaps the oscillator of the ND just runs constantly, and when you trigger it's the envelope that lets sound thru and fade away ..(So) perhaps it's something that comes with a (/this) synth and is intended -Cheers,Albert

title: RE: Alternative phase invert problem
post_content: I've noticed something similar on my new Nord Drum 2. I'm sending it notes of the exact same length (shorter than the distance between two steps), and exact same velocity. I'm using wave A1, no noise, and no click, and no Timb Env, with Timbre all the way open. I hear varying pops at the beginning of the sounds. These are accentuated if I set the Punch to Pup. My first thought is that the oscillator is not resetting at each hit. They vary more with more frequent and unevenly spaced notes. It's also very obvious with some of the other waveforms that have more high frequency content.Hopefully Nord will address this in an update. It seems like a drum synth should default to oscillator reset on note-on, the way any percussive object would. Perhaps they did this on purpose to add a little bit of "organic" variation, but in my opinion you should also be able to get predictably repetitive precision if you so desire.

title: RE: Alternative phase invert problem
post_content: +1I think that's correct, and in some cases it influences how variable the attack sounds with each hit - quite a bit..You could be right that's it's meant to add some randomness*  - or perhaps it helps to make the unit respond as fast as it does...it would indeed be nice to at least have the option to let the oscillator(s) reset with each hit - I only hope it doesn't cause any noticeable latency -Albert*not truely random of course: if you adapt the tempo you play to the pitch of the tone, the behavior should stay constant

title: RE: Alternative phase invert problem
post_content: I think I have this same issue if it means that some sounds seem to "cut" each others when they are played together. If this is intended feature I certainly don't like it! In my case I've noticed it with some claps and snare. I cannot put them together.I am not sure but to me this seems to a new issue, I haven't seen it before. Maybe it came with last update?Has anyone contacted Clavia about it?

title: RE: Alternative phase invert problem
post_content: Hi JacksonP,What gzifak and the OP are experiencing is within one channel: consecutive notes seem to have a slightly different sound, especially the attack - so that's in both ND1 and ND2 - I think the oscillators of a channel just continue running and are not reset when  a new note is triggered - resetting them when triggered would make consecutive notes sound more consistentLuc 'initials' in above post found that when you trigger 2identicalsounds from 2 or 3 channels at the same time thru MIDI - they partly cancel each other out on his ND1 - suggesting that oscillators between channels are not synchronisedResetting the oscillators when triggerred would solve the first problem above and could also help to solve Luc's problem, although it then comes down to how accurate the timing of 2 simultaneously triggered/played notes is.What you describe -at first glance- seems similar to Luc's problem with the ND1. However, you say you experience it trying to combine clap and snare sounds - clap is noise with an LFO -  a phase related problem would surprise me..I sometimes get the impression that there is some sort of dynamics processing on the total mix - or, could very well be my ears ducking under some high pressure notes  ; )Perhaps your problem is different, perhaps post a repro, upload a bank and/or recording, maybe in a new threadCheers,Albert

title: RE: Alternative phase invert problem
post_content: So does Clavia actually watch this board at all or is there some other way to contact them about this?I guess I'll make a thread for the feature request. To me it's a no-brainer. It should be easy to implement. Anything that's physically struck starts at zero-phase.

title: RE: Alternative phase invert problem
post_content: Actually...I've just recorded a patternND2phaseTest.wav(1.81 MiB) Downloaded 176 timesand it looks like the phase does reset each time. If you zoom in on the waveform, you can see that it starts at zero on each hit and then proceeds to move above the zero line.However, you can clearly hear inconsistencies between the hits. My patch is a sine wave (A1), with no punch, pitch set to 44, and bend set to 20 with a bend time of 0. Decay is 11E.I remember my Yamaha RY30 used to vary in a similar manner when I used the bend envelopes, and those were samples starting from zero phase each time. Perhaps something is inconsistent in the shape of the bend envelope? This is something I don't think I can spot by looking at the audio waveform. Any ideas? How can we get Clavia's attention to ask about this and possibly get them to address it?(Side note: I think when hits overlap due to long decay settings, the wave does not reset, in order to avoid the clicks that would result from jumping from the current position back to zero. At least this is what it looked like when I recorded some patterns with longer decays, and this is how I used to deal with this problem in Reaktor as well. I think it's appropriate behavior.)edit: also just noticed similarly audible inconsistencies when using a short timbre env on a harmonically rich wave, and no bend.

title: RE: Alternative phase invert problem
post_content: Hmm there goes my theory,I actually never recorded the ND2 to test this, I did test it with ND1 and found that starting phase did vary - however not sure now whether I looked at fully isolated notes - I think I did but...hmmm then indeed envelope and pitch bend are the only two parameters left, I will have a look this weekend, see if I can find some tricks to reveal differences between hitsThanks,Albert

title: RE: Alternative phase invert problem
post_content: I think actually that the square wave does not reset, after a quick test. I've verified that the sine, triangle and t1 waves reset. I haven't looked at the resonance modeling waves.As for the inconsistencies that seem to be caused by the bend envelopes, I will try using a sine set to the lowest frequency, and maximum bend depth with minimum time, to see if i can see distortion in the waveform.

title: RE: Alternative phase invert problem
post_content: OK more findings (based on listening with very low pitch, very short decay, no punch and no bend, with waveform recording tests to verify in case I couldn't tell by ear)phase resets at zero for the following waves:A1: yesA2: yesA3: yesA4: noA5: noA6: yesr1: nor2: not1: yesf1 to f6 (FM): yes but NOT when TIMBRE is turned up above 0H1: yes (it sounds like it varies a little with TIMBRE turned up, but no visible phase difference)H2 to C3: yes but NOT when TIMBRE is turned up above 0Based on the FM waves, this makes me think that a lot of the waves use multiple oscillators, and that the one that creates the fundamental pitch resets, but that the ones creating the harmonics don't. In my opinion they should (like a DX7 does).There is still the problem of the inconsistencies that become obvious on all waves with the introduction of the bend envelope. I'm going to do some more tests to try to figure out what this is about.

title: RE: Alternative phase invert problem
post_content: OK first I thought maybe the inconsistency had to do with a lower bandwidth for the bend envelope (called the control rate in the Nord Modular and Reaktor) than for the audio path, but I did a test in Reaktor and even bringing the control rate down to 100hz doesn't create inconsistency, just a duller pop. According to the manual the Nord Modular has a control rate of 24khz, so I doubt bandwidth is the culprit.I've seen rumors that the Drum engine is built from the G2, does anyone have one they could try to replicate a simple patch on and see if they have similar problems?

title: RE: Alternative phase invert problem
post_content: Here's a recording of the A1 wave set to the lowest pitch and triggered by a very low note at max velocity, with very short decay, maximum bend amount, and minimum bend time.ND2bendTest.wav(2.09 MiB) Downloaded 196 timesAs you can see, the number of cycles at the beginning of the waveform varies from hit to hit.Since we know the sine wave (A1) phase resets to zero (still visible here), the bend envelope must either vary in depth, starting at different pitches for each hit, or in time, moving from initial pitch to the ending pitch at varying speeds for each hit.Either way, hopefully Clavia will address this, as well as the non-resetting waveforms and waveform harmonics, in an update. As I've stated before, percussive strikes in the acoustic realm (as well as in the classic drum synths) always start at a phase position of zero.Anyone have additional insight or see errors/oversights in my logic?

title: RE: Alternative phase invert problem
post_content: The only reason I'm so concerned about these inconsistencies is that it's just about the perfect drum synth otherwise. If these problems were fixed it would be such a precise machine. I suppose it may not matter as much if you're triggering it with sticks and monitoring through a performance amp with a limited frequency range, but for electronic music styles I think we've all gotten used to accurate repetition.

title: Plug Nord Pad into a Computer?
post_content: Can I plug the Nord pad into the ethernet jack on my laptop? Is it possible to transmit midi this way too?

title: RE: Plug Nord Pad into a Computer?
post_content: Hej Nerve!No, please don't!!!The Manual, page 5 - Nord Pad Input:This connection can not be used with anyother equipment. Do not try and connecta computer network or any other RJ45equipped unit to the Nord Drum 2./AmicalementMichael in ScaniaMScEE

title: RE: Plug Nord Pad into a Computer?
post_content: Also, note that the Nord Pad does not transmit midi at all...the ND2 does based on data received from the Pad.  Removing the ND2 from the equation removes the midi as well.Bless,Pablo

title: RE: Plug Nord Pad into a Computer?
post_content: ok, I won't. Has anyone yet built a converter box or software app so the Nord PAD to be used with other devices. Whats the pinout? thanks!

title: RE: Plug Nord Pad into a Computer?
post_content: The Nord Pad is supplied power by the Nord Drum 2 whereas your computer's Ethernet port won't supply that power. On top of that you can be guaranteed that the Nord Pad doesn't communicate using the Ethernet and TCP/IP protocols. You won't ever be able to plug it directly into your computer or a network hub and you'd have to build a device so complex that it wouldn't be worth the effort.If you look at Chapter 5, page 29 of the Nord Drum 2 user manual you'll see that it acts as a Trigger-to-MIDI interface, so that conversion box you're talking about is the Nord Drum 2 itself. So connect the Nord Pad to your Nord Drum 2, connect MIDI out from the Nord Drum 2 to your device of choice, and finally turn the volume all the way down on the Nord Drum 2.That is, unless you bought a Nord Pad without buying a Nord Drum 2In which case, sell that thing on ebay and get yourself a Roland Octapad

title: RE: Can't trigger more than one drum at once from midi
post_content: How do I go about disabling individual channels and only using the Global channel?I'm using a Hosa Technology Tracklink MIDI to USB Interface.the midi channel on the nord beat 2 is set to channel 10 (on the nord drum 2 I have the midi set to channel 10 as well.)I really appreciate everyone trying to help me out on this one!!

title: RE: Can't trigger more than one drum at once from midi
post_content: Disable all channel but Globalchannel by pressing shift + midi repeatedly until display shows "CH: x" where x is the selected channel. Change the x value so that the display reads "CH.OF". Now press channel select and do the same on all six channels. After this, make sure global channel is set to channel 2 if you are using channel 2 on the Nord Beat app (display reads "GL. 2").Good Luck!

title: RE: Can't trigger more than one drum at once from midi
post_content: Hi,When you power up the unit, the firmware version is displayed shortly. With versions older than 2.x you can only set the global MIDI channel, and you won't see 'GL' in your display.On second thought, I doubt whether your problem is caused by wrong MIDI settings. Selecting the same channel (or note-) number for all individual channels will result in this: you will hear all 6 drum sounds at once* when you hit one pad (in pad mode of the app), and because each channel of the ND2 is monophonic, hitting more than 1 pad at once gives you the same as hitting one.*You didn't mention this, so I presume your problem is different.Because you mentioned your computer doesn't recognise the ND2 with the update software, I started thinking perhaps there is something wrong with your MIDI interface.. I've read a user review where someone was complaining it didn't allow him to play more than 1 or 2 notes at the same time, and sometimes skipping notes - perhaps you also have a faulty one?I hope you can try another MIDI interface, if your interface is not the problem, then.. I don't know, perhaps there is something wrong with your ND2Albert

title: RE: Reorganising banks
post_content: An ordinary STORE operation will accomplish this.  Navigate to the program you wish to copy/move, initiate STORE procedure, navigate to desired new location, and complete STORE procedure.Bless,Pablo

title: RE: Reorganising banks
post_content: Yes, that's how I rearrange banks:To copy a program just hit shift+store once, the program number will start blinking, then dial in the desired program location, when you hit the store button again the program is stored on the new locationWhen you do that directly after editing a program, the edited program will be stored on the new location,.. that's what I do to store some variations of a programCheers,AlbertEdit: Haha..it seems Pablo and I were simultaneously answering your question ..

title: Rim Shot and Rim Click - tips anyone?

title: RE: Rim Shot and Rim Click - tips anyone?
post_content: Hi there!Are you looking for additions to a snare sound that you already programmed, or to a real acoustic snare?I think a rim shot is some of the ringy overtones exaggerated, rim click is the dry woody click of course...Needless to say the ND2 is a synth and perhaps best at making surreal synthetic sounds with a very organic touch, but I think you can get quite close to acoustic sounds as well;for click check out this thread, maybe some of the sounds of the bank I uploaded there may serve as a starting point, there are some click sounds in there somewhere, but perhaps not very convincing...http://www.norduserforum.com/nord-drum- ... t5389.htmlhave fun playing & experimenting!Albert

title: RE: Rim Shot and Rim Click - tips anyone?
post_content: Hi Albert,thank you for the link.Im looking for additions to programmed snares. Ok – a Rim Click may is a mor stand alone sound but a Rim Shot should be suitable to the snare sound wich is (virtually) plyaed on.I do have a Roland PDX-100 Snare Pad wich i want to use with such sounds.Thats because i want to learn how to programm these sounds.

title: RE: Rim Shot and Rim Click - tips anyone?
post_content: Hi,About your hardware setup, just to be sure:The PDX-100 has two triggers: center and rim/edge, unlike the Roland drum-brains, your Nord Drum2 is not compatible with the rim/edge trigger of your pad. That is; with the pad connected to your ND2 it can only trigger one sound (channel), and hitting the rim won't make any difference.  EDIT: .. but you're using a Y cable to trigger 2 channels depending whether you hit head or rim.. (sorry, at first I thought this wasn't possible)A rim shot is normally played by hitting rim and head at the same time, if you also want to do that with your setup, you probably only want to program the loud overtones on the second channel. The difficult part will be the relation between how hard you hit the rim and head triggers and how exactly you program the 2 sounds dynamically, so that the whole will behave/sound as one instrument. Perhaps you also need to apply different trigger settings for rim and head. That would be cool, but no idea if it's do-able. You can also decide to only play either head or rim, which makes things easier in some aspects..Then for the rim-shot sound, start with your original snaredrum sound, and:- increase (Dyn) Timbre settings, and Timbre Decay until it starts to ring even more, but avoid a too complex sound,- or perhaps raise the pitch to a frequency of one of the overtones of your original snaredrum sound- perhaps boost it with a bit with EQ- perhaps decrease the level of the other channels because the rim-shot usually really stands out from the rest ...it will take some experimenting I guess, hope it will work!Cheers,Albert

title: RE: Rim Shot and Rim Click - tips anyone?
post_content: Hi Albert,thank you.To the setup: I'm using a Y-cable (stereo jack to 2 mono jacks) aka insert cable with the PDX, so both triggers can be used.Thats why I'm looking for aditional sounds of snares.I will try your advices.

title: RE: Rim Shot and Rim Click - tips anyone?
post_content: Ah, I see - okay!I didn't know it was possible with Roland pads (with Yamaha's it isn't - I think) - anyway I edited the above post - keep us posted!

title: Tabla
post_content: So I have been playing around trying to get some good Indian sounding drums. I lost my best one (doh!) but managed to get some good bayan bass sounds but no decent high ones. Whenever I try and make a high tuned drum of any type I seem to end up with muffled bells or tones. Anyone have any tips examples they want to share? Many thanks

title: RE: Tabla
post_content: Hi,Some tips:Start with a pitch between 60 and 63Try the drum (d) type waveforms, the harmonic (h) types may also workstart with Dyn timbre 25, timbre 5, timbre decay 20, decay 30 (or so)(just to be able to hear overtones without exaggerating too much)set Spectra until you like the pitch of the overtonesgo back to fine tune timbre settings;avoid too high timbre/dyn timbre settings, and too long timbre decay times otherwise it will sound like a gong or bell,at least use some degree of dyn timbre, because you probably want to hear more overtones when striking harder,try all click types (apart from the noise ones perhaps)You'll probably have to go back and forth a lot between the parameters, and experiment..Cheers,Albert

title: RE: Tabla
post_content: Many thanks! Im making some really great progress now, working towards having a few real world(esque) programs to work with - tabla seems to be the hardest

post_content: No worries. Im using a focusrite saffire pro 24 interface and sequence ableton off a macbook. You could try a Camera Connection Kit (CCK) and then run the ipad via usb into your hub (but it needs to be powered as ipad power through 30pin is too small to power the setup) and then to an audio interface (like focusrite scarlett or any usb based audio interface), you then get far more i/o for your money which opens possibilities like effects pedals etc. You then plug the OP1 into the USB hub.So its:Ipad -> CCK -> USB hub -> interfaceND1 -> Midi cables (standard) -> interfaceOP1 -> USB hubInterface -> monitors/headphones/DAWNo guarantees it would work but I looked at the same set-up myself (with msequencer (great app) and Loopy on ipad) but you cant run multiple apps on ipad and get a stable midi clock sync due to ios issues (hence I use ableton/macbook).Hope that helps

title: RE: OG Nord Drum VS OP-1 (refereed by iPad Air)

title: RE: OG Nord Drum VS OP-1 (refereed by iPad Air)
post_content: Hi,well I think you are ok now on the hardware side,I am a bit unfamiliar with the OP-1 so I didn't quite understand your original post,and just now figured out the OP-1 has it's own internal sequencer,Correct me if I'm wrong: You're using both the Nord Beat app and the OP-1 as sequencers - right?So on the OP-1 you have some patterns/songs, and on the Nord Beat app you also have some patterns/songs (this case the sound is coming out of your ND..)And now you're trying to synchronize the Nord Beat app with your OP-1 internal sequencer - so that you'll haveoneconcerted performance from your ND and OP-1 ...I'm not an expert on this matter but some idea's:- based on your remark: select only one device to send Sync signals, all other devices should only receive- With tempo changes MIDI Sync may take some time to properly ..synchronize,Sync seems to react a bit like tap tempo (see:http://www.norduserforum.com/nord-drum- ... t6721.html)If indeed you trying to do the above, perhaps try a different setup altogether:- useonesequencer (app) to compose your songs, and use your OP-1 and NDonlyas instruments to generate sound, - then you won't need the Sync functionif the Nord Beat app doesn't have enough tracks/options you should check others like Cubasis, Genome MIDI, StepPolyArp, or mSequencerHope this helpsAlbert

title: ND2 v3.00 Released
post_content: Hey people!Seriously juicy upgrade for our favourite noise box!I am on holiday at the moment but can't wait to get back to check this out, anyways this is pasted for your pleasurev3.00 (2014-07-04)Master Level and Pan zipper-noise bug was fixed.A lot of improvements to C1/C2 to sound.Added Ring Modulator Effect ("Distort" section).Shortened the shortest possible envelope decay times.Added detuning capabilities to triangle wave ("A2”), sawtooth wave ("A3”) and square wave ("A4")Added high-pass filtered detunable square wave ("A5")Added square wave with adjustable pulse width ("A6")Added Dual T-Filter waveform ("t1"). Inspired by classic analog drum machines.Added Ring Modulator Waveforms ("r1" and "r2).Improved Signal to Noise Ratio on Drive (eliminating low-level, high-frequency "beeps" previously present at certain noise filter settings).Fixed bug where tone part of the sound was wrapped up in pitch when playing really low midinotes.Smoother loading of programs (avoiding pops and clicks)Disclaimer: We've put a lot of effort into making programs to sound as much as possible as they did in v2.24, however some sounds will sound slightly different!Also Jon-Eirik Boska bank for download!Busy days ahead!Nord!

title: synth sounds with ND2
post_content: hello!i was wondering if it was possible to use the ND2 as a straight up virtual-analog / digital synth. for example:could i use 2 channels for a 2-osc mono bass sound and the remaining 4 channels for a 4-voice polysynth sound?any advice would be greatly appreciated!thanks.

title: RE: synth sounds with ND2
post_content: Hi,It's 6 completely independent monophonic synths in one, each with it's own MIDI channel if you wantI made some patches where I have a minimal drumset, a monophonic bass, and a monophonic lead for example - the latter 2 I can play with a keyboard, an arpeggiator app and/or a step sequencer appbut poly won't work, that is, you won't be able to play chords on a connected MIDI keyboard and hear them coming out of the ND2, not possible..perhaps if you're handy programming: let a computer split the chords you play into notes and send them to individual MIDI channels?or create a couple of MIDI tracks in your DAW (4 in your example, but up to 6 if you like) - then split up your chords yourself into the separate monophonic MIDI tracksCheers,Albert

title: RE: synth sounds with ND2
post_content: Thanks for the advice! Much appreciated.

title: RE: synth sounds with ND2
post_content: Here is a track I did with the ND2 only. Separate midi tracks for two channels with synth sounds + some chorus on them. The rest has a light reverb on them. No compression.

title: RE: synth sounds with ND2
post_content: Very cool! Thanks!Another thing I can't figure out - is it possible to set the analog oscillators to gate mode so that they sustain as long as a midi note sustains?Cheers!

title: RE: synth sounds with ND2
post_content: Hi, well,-as you probably noticed - the lengths of the notes you send thru MIDI don't influence the duration of notes coming out of your ND2, there's no setting to change that,of course, each channel is monophonic so triggering a new note on the same channel does stop the previous - but that isn't what you are after I think,- you want to be able to stop a note playing whenever you want to, but that will require some additional programming;my starting point would be a sound with quite a long decay, then:- control the Channel level (CC 7), however there is a slight zipper sound artifact when you alter level a little bit already - not sure what happens if you go to 0 directly, but check that out first, or- alter decay time(s) of tone (CC 50) and noise (CC 21), works smoothly even when a note is already playing, or- if you only need to mute 1 channel: create a silent patch on another channel and put both in the mute group, triggering the silent channel will mute your noteEdit: see below...!Albert

title: RE: synth sounds with ND2
post_content: Hi!With Cubase I managed to get a 6 voice synth with note lengths as you play them;  really cool!I started by programming the same synth sound on all 6 Channels of my ND2 (group edit), also with identical pitch (set at 60 ) but each Channel got it's own MIDI channel (Ch.xx): MIDI channel 1-6In Cubase I used 2 MIDI plugins 'midiPolyphony' and 'midiConverter3' that can be found here:http://thepiz.org/plugins/?p=pizmidi1) When you play a chord, the 'midiPolyphony' plugin splits it up and sends the individual notes to separate MIDI channels, in my case MIDI channel 1 thru 6 are available, (see screenshot)2) With 'midiConverter3' I let note-on messages turn the Decay time (CC50) to the maximum value (127), and let note-off messages turn the Decay time back to minimum value (0) - alternatively you first program a sound with a long Decay on your ND2, then let note-on messages turn Channel Level to max. (CC7, e.g. val.127) and note-off messages turn Level back to min. (CC7, val.0) - In any case, for each Channel of the ND2 I used 2 instances of this plugin, and I had to set up 3 tracks in Cubase to get it all working* (see screenshot), so I had 18+1=19 tracks in total! Of course, a MIDI recording only has to be placed on track 1 (the one with the midiPolyphony plugin), the rest of the tracks only serve to route and modify the MIDI messages before they go to the ND2..- I got best results controlling Decay time of the Tone section (CC50), I didn't test it with Noise Decay time (CC21) but should work the same- it would make more sense controlling channel Level (CC7) because then you control the whole sound (including Noise) at once.. but this method rendered some minute audio clicking as I expected .. (OS v2.x)Conclusion: it can be done but it requires some software, any VST host will be able to do it as described as aboveI bet Ableton is much better suited for these type of tricks than Cubase is - but it works, that counts- any other ideas/improvements are welcome!Have fun experimenting & playing!Cheers,Albert*In Cubase third party MIDI plugins cannot be inserted like you would plugins on audio tracks, you have to use an instrument track, more on that here:http://www.kvraudio.com/forum/viewtopic.php?t=299489

title: RE: synth sounds with ND2
post_content: Albert,Thanks so much for that! Really ingenious and generous of you to share!Best,Jivraj

title: CH.1 MIDI activates on each note
post_content: Hey guys,Maybe a newbie question, i just received my nd2 yesterday -I've been trying to set  up my nord drum to use with BitWig. I am sending MIDI Out from my card to nd2. I did the steps to assign different notes on my MIDI kbd for the 6 separate channels. The thing is channel 1 is present on every note that my midi sends out. Even if I learn this note to channel 2, channel 1 is still activating simultaneously. Please help!

title: RE: CH.1 MIDI activates on each note
post_content: Hi!In the MIDI menu, you can set the Global MIDI channel [GL.xx] but you can also assign an individual MIDI channel [Ch.yy] to each of the 6 Channels of the ND2.Perhaps you accidentally set the individual MIDI channel of Channel1 to the same as your Global MIDI channel, if so,  either set it to a different MIDI channel, - or in case you're not using the indiv. MIDI channel option, select Off [Ch.OF] on Channel1so that the 6 Channels will only respond to the set notes (60, ...) played on the Global MIDI channel..see pages 28 and 29 of the manual for further details...It's so cool what you can do with the ND2 and MIDI, quite unique and very flexible, but I can imagine it's a bit confusing for some at first

title: RE: CH.1 MIDI activates on each note
post_content: Hi Ceymore,Wartaler is 100% correct.  The ND2's available midi routing schemes are very flexible and provide radically different ways to play the instrument.  Basically, these are:1) feed the unit note data addressing all six available voices on a single midi channel, with each voice assigned to a single note on that channel, or2) assign each of the six available voices to a different midi channel.Using method 2 provides the possibility to play each of the six voices chromatically (to the extent that they may be tuned to a pitch).  One thing to watch out for when using this mode, is to ensure that the Global Midi Channel is set to something different from the six voice channels.  Similarly, when using mode 1 above you'll want to ensure that none of the individual voice channels are set to the Global Midi Channel.  Keeping these settings separate will keep your midi situation simpler and give you reliably consistent performance.Bless,Pablo

title: RE: CH.1 MIDI activates on each note
post_content: Hey guys,This is exactly what happened, the Channel 1 on ND2 was on MIDI CH.1, it is now fixedThank you all for the quick and adequate answer!

title: Midi note numbers in relation to sequencers
post_content: HITesting  ND2 and Nord Pad with various software sequencers such as Reaper and Cubase. Just interested to know where fellow ND2 users set there midi note numbers.. My manual says ND2 note numbers are shipped assigned at 60, 62, 64, 65, 67, and 69...In my version of Cubase  for example if I hit pad 1 it midi-records on octave C3 (60) in the key editor but in midi note tables number 60 is C4..Which I 'think' is what Reaper does, .and... how does all this relate to pitch settings within ND2..I am wanting to know this so as to know where to input the best placed drum sounds in terms of frequency when mixing down..any help much appreciated..

title: RE: Midi note numbers in relation to sequencers
post_content: Hi!just to be sure:Global MIDI channel:With the listed note numbers (60, etc.) you can play the different Channels (sounds) of your ND2 using the global MIDI channel. So if the global MIDI channel is 10  and you play note #60 you will hear the sound programmed on Channel#1 of your ND2, play note #62 and you'll hear Ch.2 etc - but when you play notes not in the list*, you'll hear nothing*Remark: you can change these notes in the MIDI menu, but this will only change the MIDI notes the unit reacts to when you use the global MIDI channel, not the pitch of the sound - the pitch of the sounds in this method is as set in the Tone section for each of the 6 channelsIndividual MIDI channels:For each of the 6 Channels of the ND2 you can also assign an individual MIDI channel if you likeE.g. you can assign MIDI channel 3 to Channel 4 (why not..) of the ND2, If you then play notes through MIDI channel 3, you will hear Channel 4, - and the pitch now depends on the notes played (!)If you then play note #60 on MIDI channel 3, the pitch of you'll hear will correspond to the pitch set in the Tone section of Channel 4, if this pitch is set to value 60, you'll actually hear a C when you play a C, and a D when you play a DIt's a good idea to use a different MIDI channel for any of the indiv.channels than the Global MIDI channelFor more details on pitch control check :http://www.norduserforum.com/nord-drum- ... t6570.htmlHope this helpsCheers,Albert

title: RE: Midi note numbers in relation to sequencers
post_content: Cheers Albert,yes and thanks ,,,helpful explanation of the differences between using the midi global channel and assigning individual midi channels to ND2 channels from within a  sequencer. I prefer to use the latter myself for the very reasons you stated,especially 'and the pitch now depends on the notes played (!).'Not used a keyboard yet to trigger drum notes just the Nord Pad and programming notes in the key editor in software. ..Gonna see how low a pitch/note/freq I can get for a kick drum that would be powerful in a mix but be relevant to what most speakers can handle.Nord Drum 2...love it !!!

title: RE: Midi note numbers in relation to sequencers
post_content: Ok great!Yeah, I often use keyboard as example, but as you figured, anything that outputs MIDI notes, including sequencers, etc etcThe second method -assigning individual MIDI channel(s)- is useful when you want to program/play pitch changes of a sound of one Channel during a song, Uses could be: bass synth, melodies with 'tuned percussion', or get some pitch variation in a snare soundHave fun experimenting and playing!!

title: Nord Drum 2 and Nord Pad 6 Problem
post_content: Hello all. Nice to find this place.I recently purchased a brand new Nord Drum 2, along with NordPad 6. I have been using the Nord Drum 2, with my iPad for several dayswithout problems.Today i hooked up my Nord Pad 6 and noticed a very strange behaviour which isdifficult to describe, therefore i made a short video which shows the wholesituation. In short, three of the Pads are properly triggering theircorresponding channels, but the other three are always triggering the same 3channels that remain. You will also note, that the red led NEVER lights up asa result of hitting the problematic three pads...I can not understand if this is a) a bad software setting, b) a hardwaremalfunction of Nord Drum 2, c) a hardware malfunction of the Nord Pad 6, d) ahardware malfunction of both units. I also tried a different cable, and i hadthe exact same behaviour (the video was made with the original RJ-45 cablethat was supplied by Clavia).What would you suggest? Unless i find some assistance i will be forced to return the units.The video is available at :Thank you in advance.

title: RE: Nord Drum 2 and Nord Pad 6 Problem
post_content: Hi!A while ago I reported Clavia 2 hardware related 'issues' with my unit, in short:1) Spontaneous triggering occurs at some settings: [Thres=0 + Sens>94]  -  this setting is quite extreme b.t.w. -even without any pads/triggers attached notes will be triggered randomly, perhaps caused by RFI. in my case channel 2 seems most sensitive for this (occurs most frequently on Ch.2), channel 5 to a lesser extent.Work-around however is simple: raise Threshold to 1, or lower Sens...2) Nord Pad crosstalk:With some sensitivity and threshold settings  [thres=0 + sens>74],  or [sens=100 + thres<31],  -  again perhaps quite extreme settings - hitting pad#3 (top right) also triggers the channel normally triggered by pad#6 (bottom right), but hitting pad#6 does not trigger #3.I thought perhaps pad#6 is more sensitive than the rest, but hitting pad#5 (bottom middle) does not trigger #6,(but perhaps the piezos aren't in the centre of each pad, so that piezo #3 and #6 are closer to each other than #5 and #6).I tried different cables to no avail,but the work-around is quite obvious here as well; change Thres/Sens settings..Your problem seems very similar as what I describe in 2)? -  but more severeI didn't get an answer from Clavia yet, It could be mechanical crosstalk within the Nord Pad - combined with some slight variation in sensitivity of the piezos,or electrical crosstalk within the Nord Pad, or electrical crosstalk within the Nord Drum2, - I wasn't able to test another Pad (or ND2) unit to check this[EDIT: The dutch distributor contacted me after reading this, the support request form I filled in never reached them due to technical problems, the answer was:other units show similar behavior as mine at sensitivity settings as stated above, so my unit is probably within spec]In my case -luckily- these aren't issues in real life; the settings with which I encounter these anomalies are quite extreme in my view,So -- what are the Thres and Sens settings you are using when this occurs?Cheers,Albert

I am unhappy with the fact that they have not replied to you about your issue, since this makes it more than possible that they will not help me either. I will be calling them in Sweden, really early tomorrow. title: RE: Nord Drum 2 and Nord Pad 6 Problem

title: RE: Nord Drum 2 and Nord Pad 6 Problem
post_content: FYI, inquiries submitted to the "mothership" are all read daily, but also forwarded to the national distributor of the country of origin of the email.  Generally speaking, your national distributor will be better positioned to deal with issues for reasons of language, proximity, parts supply, etc.   As a result, they are primarily responsible for responding to these inquiries.It may still be best to make initial contact through Nord website rather than going directly to your national distributor just so that the team in Stockholm can know what is going on in the world.Bless,Pablo

title: RE: Nord Drum 2 and Nord Pad 6 Problem
post_content: Hi!-When I'm in doubt I first ask around here, then contact Clavia + distributor through the form on the Clavia website, I am a bit surprised neither replied to me this time...[EDIT: due to a technical failure of the web form my request went missing, the distributor contacted me after reading this, and I'm satisfied my unit is within spec]-However, in case I'm really convinced I have a defective unit, I usually go straight to the dealer, - let them send it to the distributor for repairs -So, perhaps I was a bit quick concluding Panos' unit is broken and needs to be repaired, - well, and Pablo is right - best to let Clavia know anyway - but that's why I suggested going to your dealer in this case..Keep us posted..Cheers,Albert

title: Nord beat 2 ipad
post_content: Simple question: Does Nord Beat 2 for ipad work with Nord Drum 1?Seems very likely and it works with other drum machines. It's just the way they advertise it when they talk of Nord Beat 2Nord Drum 2 and not the first version. Thanks.

title: RE: Nord beat 2 ipad
post_content: Both Nord Beat and Nord Beat 2 are basic midi output devices.  As such, they will work with ANYTHING (even lights), capable of receiving and responding to incoming midi data stream.That said, Nord Beat 2 and Nord Drum 2 dovetail together very nicely and effectively designed to be a tandem team.Bless,Pablo

title: Considering buying this machine
post_content: I am strongly considering buying one of these but my knowledge of midi programming is none existent.I have always used General Midi software for other keyboards and drum machines.How easy is it to set up midi so I can programme drum rhythms from my PC ?  Also, I presume the Nord will download the recording so I can then play it live.Any advice much appreciatedThanks

title: RE: Considering buying this machine
post_content: Hi, it's a very versatile synth for beat making, I'm sure you'll like it!I'm not not sure what your current (software) setup is, I did spot you already have a Stage2What MIDI is, how it works, cables etc., check wikipedia, quite an extensive article!You'll need some sort of sequencing software, and perhaps a MIDI interface (hardware device), cheap and simple ESI or E-MU USB interfaces work well (I don't know to what extent your NS2 can act as one using USB MIDI, -the ND2 doesn't have MIDI over USB)Out of the box the Nord Drum 2 sends and receives MIDI messages on MIDI channel 10,With the ND2 you can program 6 different drum sounds 'channels' (not to be confused with MIDI channels) that can be used simultaneously. For example: a kick drum on ch.1, a snare on ch.2, hi-hat on ch.3, etc etc..If you'd connect your Stage2 with the Nord Drum2 using a MIDI cable, and set the Stage to transmit on MIDI channel 10, you'd be able to play the kick drum sound on the Nord Drum 2 by playing a C3 on your Stage, the snare with D3, the hi-hat with E3, etc. (the corresponding notes can be set in a menu, mentioned here are the ones set by factory) And the louder you play the louder the sound will be, or actually the ND2 can do a lot more with velocity levels than just that..In a sequencer you can record (or draw) these notes to create a drum pattern. When you hit play in your software they are sent to the Nord Drum2, voila..but there is more..You can change all parameters of the drum sounds thru MIDI, even of one individual drum sound if you like! To do the latter, you can couple individual MIDI channels to the individual channels (sounds) of the Nord Drum2.. Some sequencers will allow you to record, or program these parameter changes, .. but let's not complicate matters for now..Hope this helped,Albert

title: RE: Considering buying this machine
post_content: Please note that this is not a GM machine.  Also, you may find it useful to learn something about midi.Pablo

title: RE: Considering buying this machine
post_content: Dear FolksThanks for the replies.I probably gave a poor explanation in my opening request.I have a simple sequencer on my PC's.  One running Vista and one runs Win 7.My USB to midi works fine as I can get it to play on Yamaha DD12 what I create on the drum module of the sequencer without any programming other than input the notes/sounds using PC kepboard or mouse.I've also being using GM for about 20 years just to play backing on various Yamaha keyboards so am reasonably familiar with midi to that extent.My question should be what midi code would I need to use to interact with the Nord drum or is there some existing software that does the kob.Kind regardsJohn

title: RE: Considering buying this machine
post_content: Hi John,I'll compare the ND2 with your DD-12 because there are some similarities, but also some major differences;John wrote:My USB to midi works fine as I can get it to play on Yamaha DD12 what I create on the drum module of the sequencer without any programming other than input the notes/sounds using PC keyboard or mouse. [...] My question should be what midi code would I need to use to interact with the Nord drum or is there some existing software that does the job.> Very similar as with your DD-12 I think; set the output MIDI channel of your software to 10, input a drum sequence exactly as you are used to, with mouse or keyboard, but only using notes C3, D3, E3, F3, G3, and A3  (= note numbers 60, 62, 64, 65, 67, 69)You may wonder why only six notes? With the DD-12 and GM drum sets you can use almost any note of a piano keyboard to play a whole range of sounds.. With the DD-12 you can make use of all 75 sampled internal drum sounds at the same time through MIDI, each sound is assigned to a unique MIDI note. With the ND2 you can only use the 6 sounds of one drum set (program) at the time. It can store up to 400 programs which you can fully program at will, but you can only use 1 set of 6 sounds at the time... The good thing is that you have full control over the synthesis of each sound, almost endless possibilities; from (sort-of) acoustic drum sounds, to old-school drum machine sounds, or very weird and surreal noises, you'd no longer be stuck with a fixed set of 75 samples...John wrote:I presume the Nord will download the recording so I can then play it live.> In contrast to the DD-12, the ND2 doesn't have, and cannot store any kind of recordings, sequences, or songs on-board. You'd have to bring a laptop or iPad along if you'd want to play pre-programmed sequences/songs on stage - alternatively you could connect some drum pads to it, and play some rhythms yourself live...Cheers,Albert

title: RE: Considering buying this machine
post_content: AlbertMany thanksMost helpfulregards

title: RE: Considering buying this machine
post_content: John,I just edited my post above (once more), because I discovered in the manual of the Yamaha DD-12 that it behaves more or less like a GM device when operated thru MIDI.Cheers,Albert

title: RE: nord drum 2 looping/sequencing
post_content: Hi,Perhaps someone here has OS 1.x - I'm not 100% sure whether it ever was on the Clavia website, and if it is possible to revert to an older OS to start with... ask customer support?The downside would be that you loose FM, CC control, etc.True, the drawback of adding more devices to your setup is that you also have to carry, connect, and operate them, so I can imagine you'd prefer it built-in.. The good thing with step sequencers though is that you can get perfectly quantized loops, while with an audio delay things can get a bit messy..You could also look for a looping/delay FX processor, some reverb units also have a delay built in (+a bit of reverb can be quite nice too!) Personally, I find a real audio delay more intuitive than the built-in MIDI-like-repeat. The drawback of using an effects processor is that the same effect is applied on everything, while on the ND2 you can set delay per channel. (You could however pan the sounds you want external FX on to the left output, and the rest to the right output - and then only route left to the fx processor)Cheers,Albert

title: RE: Nord Beat : MIDI Sync the iPad with a DAW ?
post_content: Hi,I just tried it with Cubase and it works ok here,I have Cubase running on a Windows machine, I don't know the differences, but this is how I set it up:- I have a wired connection: 2 USB MIDI interfaces connecting iPad and PC to each other- in Cubase I set up the Sync (Control+click the Sync button in transport panel) by defining the interface connected to my PC as MIDI Clock destination- in Nord Beat, in the Settings menu, under MIDI devices, CLOCK SYNC, I selected 'Receive' and selected the MIDI interface connected to the iPADThe app seems a bit slow to lock on the tempo / to react to changes in tempo, it takes a couple of measures to get proper sync, but the 'StepPolyArp' app is even slower to react to changes in tempo...I think the Sync is just a metronome pulse that is sent by the DAW, the app seems to react to it as if it were tap tempo. Human tap tempo input may require some averaging, and may take some time to interpret - but with a pretty accurate MIDI sync pulse, in theory I'd say you only need 2 pulses to determine the tempo..- is it always 10bpm higher in your case / is the app responding to different tempo settings in your DAW at all?Cheers,Albert

title: Hi-hat setup?
post_content: Hey guys, I just got a nord drum (original).  I'm playing it on my simmons pads, and it's cool, but I want to get a pedal so i can open close the hihat.  Is the Nord drum setup for this?  I remember having problems getting the Roland SPDS to function like a proper hihat.  Does the nord drum have open close, and close mute action?  And if so what pedal should I get to use with my pad?  I usually play with my normal hat action pretty tight (couple centemeters), so I'd like a pedal that can be adjusted that way.I noticed in the demo on youtube he's not using a hat pedal, so I'm kind of worried that it can't handle hat pedal dynamics.

title: RE: Hi-hat setup?
post_content: Hi!Unfortunately it's not possible with ND1, for starters ND1 (and ND2) only accept simple single zone pads or triggers, nothing else. With ND2 you can make a 'mute group' where all sounds within the group mute each other, e.g. a closed hh sound will stop an open-hh sound playing, which requires 2 pads for a hi-hat.. Alternatively with ND2 it is possible to alter sound parameters (e.g. note length) thru MIDI perhaps allowing something like hi-hat open/close.Bests,Albert

title: RE: Hi-hat setup?
post_content: Ok thanks for answering my questions.I'm very curious and perturbed why no one bothers to make acceptable electronic highhat mechanics...  seems pretty damn integral to the whole "virtual" drum set concept.

title: RE: Hi-hat setup?
post_content: Hi,Nord doesn't make one, and if they make one now, it wouldn't be compatible with ND1/ND2 units. Other e-drum manufacturers do, but they are all different from each other, and will not work with the Nords directly, (or perhaps via a clever MIDI trick with Nord Drum2)..What the Nord Drum is really good at is giving a very organic, or 'natural' playing experience, just by using velocity, -whether it is a very synthetic, or a nearly acoustic sound.If you find it too limited, perhaps you should see your ND1 as a very nice addition to an acoustic-, or e-drum kit. I do think that the ND2 is a step closer to being an instrument (or drumkit if you like) in it's own right.You suggest adding hi-hat trigger compatibility, - or one could also think of:- multi-zone/position sensing (think of Mandala or Roland)- choke (mute with your hands)- well, just look at what some e-drum brands have made, esp. look at the features of the 'supernatural' series by RolandSonically I guess future Nord Drums will not make an attempt to mimic acoustic drumsets, but I agree incorporation of some of the above sensing techniques /pad types might make them even more expressive than current, we'll have to wait and see.Cheers,Albertbtw check the vic virth site 'A History of the Drumset':double drumming.jpg (1 MiB) Viewed 3163 times

title: How can I program the pitch changing in external MIDI sequen
post_content: Hey guys,How can I program the pitch changing of a snare for example in external MIDI sequencer or DAW? (I use Pro Tools)I don't quite understand how MIDI CC works, can you give me a simple explanation, plz?I just checked the Nord Beat main features, it looks like the app can't change the pitch of the sounds.

title: RE: How can I program the pitch changing in external MIDI sequen
post_content: Hi,Sorry for the late reply, I was hoping someone else would answer because I'm not familiar with Pro-Tools MIDI setup, I didn't even know it can do anything with MIDI1) set the MIDI channel [Ch.x] of the ND2 Channel with the snare sound, take care to choose a different value for x than the Global MIDI channel y  [GL.y] (see page 23/24 & 28/29 in current manual)2) generate a MIDI track in your DAW that sends MIDI to channel x3a) for discrete notes: with a keyboard record/program different notes; the pitch of the snare will depend on the note played. If you use this method you will have to make a separate track (one that sends to MIDI channel x) for the snare sound3b-1) for slightly more precise control over pitch set: [CC.Sr] in the MIDI menu of your ND2, - to allow sending and receiving CC control messages.You might want to figure out how ProTools deals with CCs, but to complicate things: for the enhanced precision over pitch, the ND2 uses 2 CCs to control it: CC63 (LSB) and CC31(MSB),a pragmatic approach would be to record the CCs that the ND2 sends when you alter pitch on the unit:3b-2)  while adjusting pitch on your ND2, record MIDI on the track created in step 2 -3b-3) upon playback you should see the pitch value change on your ND2 display, and/or if you play it alongside your existing MIDI drumtrack the pitch of the snare sound should change...Hope this helps,Albert

title: Nord Beat 2 setup
post_content: Hi. I'd like to ask about the proper midi setup for Nord Beat 2 with Nord Drum 2.When I downloaded NB2, default midi channel was 10, but it didn't work at all.So I tried other midi channels and when I chose channel 1, it finally worked.But another problem has come up- whenever other 5 channels are triggered(2~6), channel 1 is triggered too.So I shut down the channel 1 and I end up using only 5 channels because of the problem.Isn't it supposed to be working without additional settings?Or is it the way it works and I should live with it?Please tell me you know how to fix this.I use iRig midi and apple 30 to lightning cable.They all seem to be fine, I don't think it's a hardware problem.Here is my midi setup parameters in NB2MIDI channel: 1MIDI note1: 602: 623: 644: 655: 676: 69

title: RE: Nord Beat 2 setup
post_content: Hi!How is your ND2 MIDI set up?Normal setup of the ND2 in combination with NB2 app:1) Match Global the MIDI channel of your ND2 [GL.x] in the MIDI menu, with the MIDI channel in the NB2 app2) Match the MIDI notes [n.x] for each of the 6 ND2 Channels - with the notes in the NB2 app3) Make sure the individual MIDI channels of the ND2 Channels [Ch.x] are either different than the MIDI channel set in the app, or OFFYou set the app to send notes to MIDI channel 1, I think apart from correctly setting Global MIDI channel to 1 [GL.1] in your ND2, you also activated individual MIDI channel of ND2 Channel 1, and set it to MIDI channel 1  [Ch. 1],result: whatever note is played in the app is sent to expected ND2 Channel via the Global MIDI channel, but also to ND2 Channel 1, (the pitch of the note played by ND2 channel 1 varies depending which note is played in the app)See latest version of the manual page 23/24 and 28/29 for further details..http://www.nordkeyboards.com/downloads/nord-drum-2Cheers,Albert

post_content: Hi, welcome!TouchOSC and Lemur are apps in which you can create your own ND2-controller, place your knobs, sliders etc. on the screen as you like, which then will send CCs to the ND2.Lemur isn't cheap, if you have it you can run the template made by Jarvis:http://www.norduserforum.com/nord-drum- ... t6295.htmlTouchOSC is cheaper, but much more limited, I have made a template for a few parameters which I will share later..I can't advice you on hardware sequencers, but there are others for the iPad apart from Nord Beat.Cheers,Albert

title: RE: ND2 and Roland TD-20
post_content: Hi,Unfortunately, MIDI settings cannot be set per program, ...so they remain the same, triggering the same sounds of your TD-20 regardless of the program you select on your ND2I'm afraid you will have to change programs of both units, for each song,Make silent patches on both units, etcCheers,Albert

title: RE: ND2 and Roland TD-20
post_content: Thanks Albert,that saves me chasing something that's impossible.Most of the percussion sounds I need are actually more or less already among the factory sounds, at least if I just shuffle and tweak them a little. The only thing I really miss is something that resembles chimes. Any ideas how I might create that sound?- Tore

title: RE: ND2 and Roland TD-20
post_content: what kind of chimes? The ones you can individually play?If you have OS2.24 installed try FM synthesis, you probably don't need a noise component, so set mix to just tone,play with spectra, timbre, timbre decay, and decay settings, when you are close to something you like copy the sound to all channels, then select all channels for group edit, then set a scale (shift-pitch) and fine tune all parameters (in group edit changes apply to all channels selected) until you have a nice sounding set of tubular bells, chimes, or the like!Have fun experimenting!Albert

title: RE: ND2 and Roland TD-20
post_content: Good tip, I'll certainly have a go, but what I'm after is more of sound where I make a single hit on a pad, and the sound is like when you swipe the whole row of chimes. I had something like it on my old SPD-20 (quite crappy sound that was, though). Here is an examplehttp://www.thomann.de/se/meinl_ch27st_chimes.htm. There is a button on the page where one can play a sound sample.

title: RE: ND2 and Roland TD-20
post_content: I was afraid you meant that typebecause that is not possible with the ND2either get a small sampler, a real LP or Meinl chimes set, or buy some tubes and replicate itCheers,Albert

title: Nord Drum 2 vs Nord Lead 4
post_content: SOOOOO I have a lead 4. I'm looking for a percussion solution and the Drum 2 has been on my radar. Thing is, the Nord Drum 2 plus the pad isn't the cheapest thing in the world so I'm just a tad hesitant. I was wondering, how different is the synth engine in the Drum 2 vs the Lead 4. The 4 can make some nice drum sounds and it has 4 parts so conceivably, if I could make due with 4 parts I could get a midi pad/trigger and play some percussion with the Lead 4. I've never had my hands on the Drum 2 so does anyone here have both? Are the engines similar? Different enough to warrant having both? Def appreciate the input.

title: RE: Nord Drum 2 vs Nord Lead 4
post_content: I wonder if the envelopes on the NL4 are quick enough, especially the attack phase. The Waldorf Blofeld is quite good for percussive sounds, specifically because you can make the attack phase so short. You could try using noise as an oscillator and see how short you can get the attack.Is the Nord Drum an option? It seems to cost about 200 euro, while the Nord Drum 2 costs 500. No idea what the differences are though.

title: RE: Nord Drum 2 vs Nord Lead 4
post_content: For sure I'm not against the nord drum one. I'm just trying to avoid anything overly redundant in my setup. I like the percussive stuff I've pulled from the lead4, I'm just wondering if there are components to the drum2 that make it more expressive for percussion than the lead.

title: RE: Nord Drum 2 vs Nord Lead 4
post_content: chvad wrote:I'm just wondering if there are components to the drum2 that make it more expressive for percussion than the lead.I do tooApart from the speed of the envelopes, it seems to me the Lead 4 is more flexible if triggering via MIDI is an option.

title: RE: Nord Drum 2 vs Nord Lead 4
post_content: The Nord Lead 4 and Nord Drum 2 are two very different beasts.The Nord Drum 2 drum engine consists of three parallel parts - noise, tone and click.The tone part also features drum models that are not possible through traditional subtractive synthesis.Hope this helps you decide.

title: RE: Nord Drum 2 vs Nord Lead 4
post_content: def helps! thanks!

title: RE: Nord Drum 2 program change and bank select
post_content: The correct way to enter bank change in the ND2 is as following:Controller change 0, value 0Controller change 32, value 0-7 (this is essentially bank number 1-8)then program change which triggers the program change

title: RE: Nord Drum 2 program change and bank select
post_content: Make sure the ND2 has CC on SR (send and receive) in MIDI menu.And send Bank MSB (most significant byte) CC#00 first, then Bank LSB (least significant byte) CC#32 second.Also, try to connect logic directly to ND2 to opt out all other potential fail sources.edit: OK, apparently you found the problem.

title: RE: MIDI Recording and Beat 2 App
post_content: Hi Jason,The ND2 indeed sends MIDI to your iPad, but the Nord Beat 2 app doesn't record incoming MIDI messages, - (if i'm not mistaken)perhaps an idea for a next version to include a REC buttonBest,Albert

title: RE: MIDI Recording and Beat 2 App
post_content: Thanks for the reply Albert. That would be a very useful function indeed. For now, I'll enjoy the sequencer sans Pad.

title: RE: MIDI Recording and Beat 2 App
post_content: So to loop a pattern that you have played with the ND2/pad combo you need to connect it to Beat 2? Or does the ND2 have a built in looper/sequencer?

title: RE: MIDI Recording and Beat 2 App
post_content: Hi Stoat,The Nord Drum 2 doesn't have a sequencer function onboard, it is a 6 channel drum 'brain'/sound module, the Nord Beat iPad app can accompany the Nord Drum2 to add the step sequencer function..You can design and edit a drum loop/sequence in Nord Beat 2, which is a 6 track step-sequencer -that doesn't produce any sound itself-, but when you connect the Nord Drum 2 to the iPad using a MIDI interface, the Nord Drum 2 will act as a sound module.When you connect triggers, pads, or the Nord Pad, to the Nord Drum2, you can play drum sounds live, the notes you play are sent from the MIDI output, which you can record in any DAW/sequencer. The Nord Beat 2 app however doesn't have a record function. If I'm not mistaken, the only way to design and edit a sequence in the NB2 app is in the step sequencer grid screen.Of course, it is possible to play the Nord Drum live with pads (or in 'pad mode' of the app) along with whatever pattern is played with the app..Cheers,Albert

title: RE: MIDI Recording and Beat 2 App
post_content: Hi All,I tried to jump in on this thread a bit earlier, but fell asleep first!Jason did correctly catch something from that vid -- it does appear that Jon-Eirik is recording sequences live, but this is another case where appearances are deceiving.  He is using the REPEAT function there.  Setting it to a value of 20 maximizes feedback.  In actual effect it does work out to behaving like a looped sequence, but in reality it's the repeat function you are hearing.Another fine example of the kinds of flexibility Nord designs allow...Bless,Pablo

title: RE: MIDI Recording and Beat 2 App
post_content: Thanks Pablo!missed that part.. You are right!Clever old trick, same as done with delay/loop stompboxes etcHowever, with current (OS2.24) setting echo/repeat to 20 no longer results in endless repeat..the echoes in current OS fade away a bit too quickly to be used as in the videoGreetings,Albert

title: RE: Nord Drum 2 impressions
post_content: It finally arrived!!Nord Drum2 in short: Very addictive!As JP mentioned, much more complex, richer sounds, and a lot more to tweak!Whatever sound I hear on TV, or in music, I am able to reproduce it with the ND2 pretty quickly!Even the sea!Issues / Feature requests?Not much to complain, and Nord has already announced FM synthesis, and CC control coming in a future OS update.- Only minor stuff:(1) I did notice that the 'this program has been edited' light doesn't work - the LED in my display is fine - (it lights up shortly when you go from one program to the next). I bet this will be corrected with next OS, nothing dramatic imo.(2) I have some weird things going when I apply noise attack (Ad type) AND have the echo effect active - when you trigger notes shortly after each other, noise is sometimes muted/not triggered..  bit erratic, can't explain....well it isn't a combination I'd normally use anyway..(3) A slight 'zipper' noise from the main volume knob when you adjust volume while playing - I can perfectly live with that(4) Idea about Group Edit Pitch:With group edit you can adjust pitch of 2 or more channels at the same time, while maintainig differences between the channels (scale). The scale is lost when you keep adjusting after one or more channels reached max.or min. pitch. My idea is to stop further adjustment of pitch when one of the selected channels has reached the max (or min.) pitch, so that differences between channels are maintained.(5) idea about midi/channelsIn the light of CC-control; it would perhaps be handy if you could assign individual midi channel to each channel of the ND2(6) you can only select Yam/Roland rubber pads, with ND1 you can also select different mesh, and acoustic triggers. - don't know if it's really necessaryAll in all - very happy so far, not much to complain about really!!Plus, I absolutely love the sound of this little red synth!!Cheers,Albertbased on ND2 OS 0.92

title: RE: Nord Drum 2 impressions
post_content: wartaler wrote:wartaler wrote:(2) I have some weird things going when I apply noise attack (Ad type) AND have the echo effect active - when you trigger notes shortly after each other, noise is sometimes muted/not triggered..  bit erratic, can't explain....well it isn't a combination I'd normally use anyway..-still there in OS2.xwartaler: I don't think this is a bug - since the echo is sort of a monofonic "played" echo (think midi echo) with lesser velocity than your trigger, if you increase noise attack the echoes will make the attack velocity curve less step. title: RE: Nord Drum 2 impressions
post_content: Well, I see what you mean but it behaves irratically;Repro:noise attack: 23 / env: Adnoise decay: 2 / lo: offecho: 10 / amount: 20tempo at 120 bpm>action: trigger with trigger button (set at max)>result: first note is loudest, then echoes decay = as expected>action: trigger new note(s) while you stll hear echoes of the previous,>result:sometimesthe new note is very soft (equally soft as theechoof the first sound),sometimesit is very loud,sometimeslevel is normal (as originally programmed)When I trigger a new note, I expect it to start with the noise sound I programmed, which then decays with echoes,- tone and click do behave as expected, so you get a weird mix where noise level is variating each time you trigger...It is the combination of noise attack (Ad type) and echo (normal echo), do note:- the problem does NOT occur with rEP (straight repeat) type of echo..Ok, I hope you can reproduce it, I do think it is some sort of 'bug' in the software, [EDIT: it isn't, Kroffe was right!]Cheers,AlbertND2/OS2.24

title: Nord Drum 2 Help
post_content: I have my ipad connected to my Nord Drum 2 via the irig midi connection, Using Nord Beat 2 to sequence it. I have the midi channel set to 10 on the ipad and have set each channel on the nord drum to 10. the midi notes are set as follows:-CH1 - 60CH2 - 62CH3 - 64CH4 - 65CH5 - 67CH6 - 69When playing a sequence, instead of each individual channel playing a sound. I'm just getting all channels playing at the same time. if i switch to pad mode and hit pad 5. instead of playing the sound on channel 5 it plays a pitched up version of  all the channels at once.I just want it to sequence like a normal drum machine and each pad i hit to play the channel with the sound on it and not a pitched up version.ThanksFrankie

title: RE: Nord Drum 2 Help
post_content: Hi!You have set all individual channels to listen to midi channel 10,in that case all 6 channels of the ND2 will respond to ANY note played on midi channel 10(you can actually use a keyboard to play melodies in this mode if you want)Instead you need to only set the Global midi channel to 10, individual channels: Offthen all 6 ND2 channels will only respond to the set note (60, ...) played on midi channel 10Albert

title: RE: Nord Drum 2 Help
post_content: Try to use global channel 10 and set all the other channels off. Then the channels will respond to your incoming notes at 60, 62, 64, 65, 67, 69.edit: doh, wartaler beat me to it.

post_content: yeahhappy you confirmed,I think it is quite cool how you can now sooo much with midi

title: Nord Drum 2 first impression and wishlist
post_content: Have been playing with and programming the Nord Drum 2, and it's a real treat.I think the manual has parts from the Nord Drum 1, that haven't been updated properly. For example the DYN elements all say that you can set a second parameter (if you keep turning the knob to the right) that will be used when you strike the pad harder. However you access the second parameter like you do with all second parameters using the "lower parameter button", and the result is theopposite, the second value is used when you strike lightly and the first parameter is used when you strike harder.The unit outputs midi note data when you use the pads, which is great if you want to blend the sounds with samples.  However there is no Midi Through function, so if you use an Octapad to trigger the unit, the midi notes do not pass through and you can't blend the sounds with samples.My wishlist item is simple and probably easy to implement  - have a system parameter for Midi Through!Currently there is a Local on/off parameter that works as expected muting the inputs of the triggers when OFF.  However if you are using an octapad or other midi input, this is not enough - as that midi is never sent to the output to be recorded.  So you have to have the octapad go to the computer and that signal back out to the unit.  It's workable, but a midi through on/off would make the unit a little more flexible.

title: RE: Nord Drum 2 first impression and wishlist
post_content: However you access the second parameter like you do with all second parameters using the "lower parameter button", and the result is theopposite, the second value is used when you strike lightly and the first parameter is used when you strike harder.Yeah, noticed this also, it is exactly the other way round..

title: RE: Nord Drum 2 first impression and wishlist
post_content: Apart from what I listed here:http://www.norduserforum.com/nord-drum- ... t5410.htmlI was also thinking about the Noise section: you can do a lot of tricks with noise now, but despite the 3 different filter types, & cutoff, I'm unable to replicate some nice noise based sounds from my ND1, which has noise 'filter/type' and 'color' parameters. Also, with ND2 you get a filter sweep when you engage filter dynamics, the filter then becomes dependent of both decay time, and striking force at the same time, with ND1 you can set sweep time independently of decay time..plus, with ND1 you can also increase the decay time of the Click, so that the click becomes more part of the overall sound, extra layer, with ND2 the clicks are all very short, can't set decayI know it sounds a bit strange given all new noise features but perhaps adding a noise waveform to the Tone section could help making some nice noise sounds, -by layering- like gunshot type of sounds etc I used to do with ND1..Cheers,Albert
